=== [[Talk:Sharon Tate#rfc_25308F4|Talk:Sharon Tate]] expired 2017-01-01 02:01 ===
* Id: 25308F4
* User: Winkelvi
* Date: 2016-12-25 20:26:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|756644512|BIO 756644512}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|756644513|HIST 756644513}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|756644515|MEDIA 756644515}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|757677837|BIO 757677837}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|757677839|HIST 757677839}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|757677841|MEDIA 757677841}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There is a dispute over content in the lede of this article ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Sharon_Tate&type=revision&diff=756492680&oldid=756491938 diff here]). The concern was in regard to the suitability of the content per [[WP:LEDE]]. The content was removed but later reinstated (with citations); the reinstating editor states the content has existed for an extended period of time. The discussion ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk:Sharon_Tate&oldid=756539136#Top_Billing diff here]) has not been productive and could benefit from more opinions. 

The specific question is: '''Should this content be added to the lede?'''. Please respond in the following manner:

*'''Support''', keep in lede
*'''Oppose''', remove from lede
*'''Other''': any other solution including rephrasing

When you respond, please use the "Survey" section below and the "Discussion" section for any threaded discussions. Thank you. -- <span style="text-shadow: 4px 4px 15px #0099FF, -4px -4px 15px #99FF00;">[[User:Winkelvi|WV]]</span> ● <span style="text-shadow: 4px 4px 15px #FF9900, -4px -4px 15px #FF0099;">[[User_talk:Winkelvi|✉]] [[Special:Contributions/Winkelvi|✓]]</span>  20:26, 25 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Redirects for discussion#rfc_AC46EDA|Wikipedia talk:Redirects for discussion]] expired 2017-01-02 02:01 ===

* User: GeoffreyT2000
* Date: 2016-12-03 01:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we allow daily log pages with no nominations in them apart from those within 3 days from today? Here are 2 options:
*Option 1: Delete all existing past empty log pages, which are the following:

With Option 2, the links in the header on the preceding and following log pages will have to be fixed so that undeleted or created log pages will no longer be skipped. === [[Wikipedia talk:Bot policy#rfc_29C4FAB|Wikipedia talk:Bot policy]] expired 2017-01-02 20:01 ===
* Id: 29C4FAB
* User: Xaosflux
* Date: 2016-12-03 19:19:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|752858506|PROP 752858506}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|757974807|PROP 757974807}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I propose we adopt an activity requirement for approved bots on the English Wikipedia.  Rare bots are expected to be read-only, but some have only on-demand tasks.  As such, tying in operator activity may be accounted for.  The proposed policy addition is:
* <big>Bot accounts that have had no logged actions or edits for two years, where the listed operator has also had no logged actions or edits for two years, will be deauthorized.  Following a one week notification period on the [[Wikipedia:bot owners' noticeboard|bot owners' noticeboard]], and the operator's talk page, prior task approvals will be considered expired and bot flags will be removed.  Should the operator return and wish to reactivate the bot, a new [[Wikipedia:Bots/Requests for approval|request for approval]] must be completed.</big>

This puts the policy more in line with the practice of retiring dormant bot accounts.  Unsupervised bot accounts present a moderate security risk, should they be compromised high speed editing or slow-speed but less visible editing could take place.  Additionally, community policies and practices evolve over time and formerly approved bot tasks may no longer be appropriate.  See recent BOWN discussions:
:[[Wikipedia:Bot_owners'_noticeboard#Inactive_bots_with_inactive_editors_to_mark_as_retired]]
:[[Wikipedia:Bot_owners'_noticeboard#Inactive_bots_over_5_years]]

Thank you, — [[User:Xaosflux|<span style="color:#FF9933; font-weight:bold; font-family:monotype;">xaosflux</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:Xaosflux|<span style="color:#009933;">Talk</span>]]</sup> 19:19, 3 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Pending changes/Request for Comment 2016#rfc_FB53883|Wikipedia:Pending changes/Request for Comment 2016]] expired 2017-01-02 23:01 ===
* Id: FB53883
* User: George Ho
* Date: 2016-12-12 09:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|754379265|POLICY 754379265}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|754379268|PROP 754379268}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|758002140|POLICY 758002140}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|758002142|PROP 758002142}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the [[WP:PC2|PC2]] level allow extendedconfirmed editors' edits to be automatically accepted, and should PC2 be used as a softer alternative to [[WP:ECP|ECP]], subject to the following criteria?
#The criteria for [[Wikipedia:Protection policy#Pending changes protection|autoconfirmed pending changes protection]] ("PC1") are met but the latter has proven ineffective, and blocks would be ineffective,
#And/or the criteria for [[Wikipedia:Protection policy#Extended confirmed protection|extended-confirmed protection]] are met.

In addition, the [[WP:AN|administrator's noticeboard]] will be notified (manually or automatically) of each use (identical to current [[WP:ECP]] notification).

<small>--'''''Relisting''''' [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:Cenarium&diff=753828214&oldid=753758415 permitted] by [[User:Cenarium|Cenarium]]. [[User:George Ho|George Ho]] ([[User talk:George Ho|talk]]) 09:10, 12 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:Infobox river#rfc_D09B1B7|Template talk:Infobox river]] expired 2017-01-03 04:01 ===

I am looking at cleaning up this infobox. I was going to replace instances of {{param|basin_countries}} with {{param|subdivision_name1}}. The param is deprecated and tracked with [[:Category:Pages using infobox river with "basin countries" parameter]]. Just wanted to make sure there were no objections. === [[Talk:Jawaharlal Nehru#rfc_266402A|Talk:Jawaharlal Nehru]] expired 2017-01-03 06:01 ===
* Id: 266402A
* User: Soham321
* Date: 2016-12-29 04:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|757167316|BIO 757167316}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|757167326|HIST 757167326}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|757167329|SCI 757167329}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|757167331|RELI 757167331}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|758055873|BIO 758055873}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|758055875|HIST 758055875}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|758055881|SCI 758055881}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|758055884|RELI 758055884}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
On 23 July, 2015, large chunks of this article were deleted. See [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Jawaharlal_Nehru&diff=672709346&oldid=672626463 diff1] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Jawaharlal_Nehru&diff=672711045&oldid=672710205 diff2]. The deleted content included the following sections:
*On Caste system, and Caste based reservations (chunks of this section deleted)
*Religion (chunks of this section deleted)
*Budhism
*On Cow Protection
*On Spiritualism in India
*Secular State
*Views on communalism
*Nehru and Science
*Nehru as a person
*Nehru and Patel
*On Communism, Fascism, and Hindu Right-wing Communalism in India

Other changes were made to reduce the neutrality of the article. For instance, the words "According to a ''Times of India'' editorial, Nehru  left behind a disputed legacy, being "either adored or reviled for India's progress or lack of it." were changed to "Nehru, thus, left behind a disputed legacy, being "either adored or reviled for India's progress or lack of it." These words have exactly one source to back them up which is a Times of India editorial. So the previous version was clearly better and not the changed version (which exists till date).

Also, what makes the large scale deletions (refer to diffs given above) curious is that the person who carried them out (refer to diffs given above) has been [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Special:Log/block&page=User%3AD4iNa4 blocked for socking in the past] and is [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:D4iNa4&diff=754972625&oldid=751264060 again being accused of socking]. I am pinging this editor so that he is aware of the outcome of the RfC: {{u|D4iNa4}}

This RfC is being initiated to determine whether the removed content should be re-inserted into the main article. Please vote '''Support''' to accept my proposal to re-insert the deleted material or '''Oppose''' to maintain the status quo.[[User:Soham321|Soham321]] ([[User talk:Soham321|talk]]) 04:11, 29 December 2016 (UTC)}}
This discussion needs some outside help since the two discussants here seem to be talking past each other. [[User:Kdammers|Kdammers]] ([[User talk:Kdammers|talk]]) 03:52, 25 December 2016 (UTC)}}

The article is concerned with an [[English language]] [[neologism]] – "''a relatively new or isolated term, word, or phrase that may be in the process of entering common use, but that has not yet been fully accepted into mainstream language''." As such, should the article be '''required''' at this time to present a global view of the term, given that it is relatively new and not in mainstream use? === [[Wikipedia talk:Username policy#rfc_B53AD11|Wikipedia talk:Username policy]] expired 2017-01-03 22:01 ===
* Id: B53AD11
* Date: 2016-12-04 21:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|753045468|POLICY 753045468}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|758171928|POLICY 758171928}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
We seem to have an ongoing issue with certain types of names being reported at [[WP:UAA]]. They generally fall into one of the following categories:

:*Some random non-notable persons name paired with "official" or "productions" 
:*Some non-notable YouTube channel or blog name

These are reported as being promotional usernames, both by the bot and by users. They are usually tagged as promotional usernames. The current wording of [[WP:CORPNAME]] does not appear to support blocking these names as they represent individuals, not organizations. Yes, they are usually engaging in editing that is not desirable, such as creating social media style "profile" user pages or trying to write an article on their personal  YouTube channel. But is it the ''editing'' or the ''username'' that administrators should be concerned with? Can we, as a matter of policy,  block these names? If we can, should we? If we cannot or should not should we actively discourage users from reporting these names? 21:57, 4 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Poland#rfc_085229D|Talk:Poland]] expired 2017-01-03 22:01 ===
* Id: 085229D
* User: Oliszydlowski
* Date: 2017-01-03 00:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|757992495|UNSORTED 757992495}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|758171930|UNSORTED 758171930}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should 16 million tourists and the 16th position in the world describe Poland as "one of the most visited countries in the world" in the lead section?--[[User:Oliszydlowski|Oliszydlowski]] [[User talk:Oliszydlowski|(TALK)]], 2 January 2016, 22:23 (UTC)
*No. There's no need for it. 16M and 16th/18th are a) accurate, b) precise, and c) specific. "One of the most visited countries in the world" is a) only arguably accurate, b) not precise, and c) vague. It's also editorialising; I don't much mind the stressing of positive things in this lead, but let the facts speak for themselves. [[User:EddieHugh|EddieHugh]] ([[User talk:EddieHugh|talk]]) 00:52, 3 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Thomas Mair (murderer)#rfc_2276F02|Talk:Thomas Mair (murderer)]] expired 2017-01-03 23:01 ===
* Id: 2276F02
* User: HelgaStick
* Date: 2017-01-03 16:58:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|758125022|UNSORTED 758125022}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|758180064|UNSORTED 758180064}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
==== 1: Categories '''

*I think that the categories should be included, as the term "assassin" has been used by a number of sources. If the consensus is to use "murderer" in the article text, that's fine, but an assassination is a specific form of murder and these categories are not mutually exclusive. Therefore, I would tend to agree that the "assassination" categories should be reinstated in the article.

::However, an entire section on the use of the term "assassination" seems unwarranted; unless a discussion about this term in particular relating to Mair appears in reliable sources, this should be avoided. [[User:HelgaStick|HelgaStick]] ([[User talk:HelgaStick|talk]]) 16:58, 3 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:2017 Istanbul nightclub attack#rfc_1352CA5|Talk:2017 Istanbul nightclub attack]] expired 2017-01-06 05:01 ===
* Id: 1352CA5
* User: 80.132.91.226
* Date: 2017-01-02 18:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|757965403|POL 757965403}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|758562306|POL 758562306}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The table in the section "Victims" has been wrong since it was added. The numbers don't add up mathematically, and some of the sources used contradict each other. This is no surprise since there is no official tally yet. It has been deleted until we get the data, but of course it was restored although it is obviously wrong. At some point someone even changed the (sourced) numbers in the lead to match the table.
My suggestion is that we replace it with a short summary (in prose) of the confirmed numbers, even if those are not yet complete, and wait with a full tally until the data is available. [[Special:Contributions/80.132.91.226|80.132.91.226]] ([[User talk:80.132.91.226|talk]]) 18:39, 2 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Tom Brady#rfc_2753351|Talk:Tom Brady]] expired 2017-01-07 05:01 ===
* Id: 2753351
* User: Tarl N.#top
* Date: 2016-12-16 00:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|756378935|BIO 756378935}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|758725801|BIO 758725801}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Since we have had deflategate information in the lead bouncing in and out over the months, let's discuss it here. There was a statement added and reverted, <i>Brady was suspended for the first four games of the 2016 season for his alleged part in the football tampering scandal known as [[Deflategate]].</i>

I'd contend that a statement to that effect belongs in the lede. There is a detailed section under the 2015 season on the subject, and it is a hotly debated topic to this day. That argues it should receive a mention in the lede, particularly as it <i>will</i> get brought up when he's considered for the Hall of Fame. The suspension itself (4 games) is largely meaningless, but the bitter legal battle between one of the marquee names in the sport and the Commissioner going almost to the Supreme Court, deserves mention in the lead. I would suggest a statement more like:

<i>Brady was alleged to have participated in the football tampering scandal known as [[Deflategate]]. The back-and-forth conflict between Brady and Goodell escalated through the courts being reversed multiple times, at one point looking like it was going to be appealed to the [[Supreme Court of the United States|Supreme Court]]. After more than a year of court battles, Brady served a 4-game suspension at the beginning of the 2016 season, ending the legal battles.</i>

Comments? [[User:Tarl_N.|<font color="green">'''Tarl N.'''</font>]] ([[User talk:Tarl N.#top|<font color="teal">discuss</font>]]) 00:43, 16 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Macedonia (ancient kingdom)#rfc_D269DD1|Talk:Macedonia (ancient kingdom)]] expired 2017-01-08 10:01 ===
* Id: D269DD1
* User: Judist
* Date: 2017-01-08 01:11:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|758879708|HIST 758879708}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|758935812|HIST 758935812}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The stance of the Greek state in the [[Macedonian dispute]](among the most controversial issues in Europe) has already made its way as a definition of the leads of Wikipedia articles such as [[Ancient Macedonians]]. So, let's ask who has written it? In the edit history - it seems the Greek users. So, I think more users should define this in a RfC. The suggestion is the following - all the "essentially Greek" definitions to be removed from the leads of Ancient Macedonia-related articles and to be replaced with a neutral and balanced statements that would give weight to other authors and will not declare any theory as a fact - but only as a theory. I '''support''' the second proposal. At least anything more neutral than the current situation that may be proposed by the closing administrator would be more acceptable. [[User:Judist|Judist]] ([[User talk:Judist|talk]]) 01:11, 8 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_8FD6780|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2017-01-10 01:02 ===
* Id: 8FD6780
* User: Philroc
* Date: 2017-01-09 21:02:00

{{rfcquote|text=
If you're reviewing a GA nominee article and you put it on hold because it has minor issues, what's the point of waiting the prescribed time if you find all of the issues are fixed before that time is up? I'd like to change the policies concerning good article reviews so that if an on-hold nominee article has all of its issues fixed before the on-hold time is up, a reviewer can promote the article right away. I'd like to know what you think about that. [[User:Philroc|<font color="#009933">Phil</font>]][[User talk:Philroc|<font color="#000000">roc</font>]]<sup>[[Special:Contributions/Philroc|''My contribs'']]</sup> 21:02, 9 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Ehsan Sehgal#rfc_60A7148|Talk:Ehsan Sehgal]] expired 2017-01-10 01:02 ===
* Id: 60A7148
* User: Justice007
* Date: 2017-01-09 13:03:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|759206801|UNSORTED 759206801}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|759240220|UNSORTED 759240220}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
* When conduct and edits fail to execute the real conception and context of rules, the neutrality collapse within itself. The question, that was raised, with [[User:Saqib|Saqib]], on the talk pages; [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Shahid_Masood#Deletion_without_consensus 1], 
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Biographies_of_living_persons/Noticeboard#Javed_Malik_and_Haider_Qureshi 2],  
[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Dispute_resolution_noticeboard#Wikipedia:Biographies_of_living_persons.2FNoticeboard.23Javed_Malik_and_Haider_Qureshi 3], became the question of monopoly and the kinds of threats and harassment, and Wikihounding [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Haider_Qureshi 1] since I restored the well-sourced content and removed the illegitimate tags.  As a result, this article also became under tagging attack, and my privacy and identity revealed, which attempted to prevent from further editing. This article was edited by the multitude of unaffiliated editors involved in this article. 

Article [[Ehsan Sehgal]] has edited by the multitude, experience, and unaffiliated editors purely adopting [[WP:NPOV|NPOV]].

Please take a look at the edit history that, who and how the article was edited, improved and sourced. It demonstrates that recent edits by [[User:Winged Blades of Godric|Winged Blades of Godric]] is messed with own choice, rejecting the edits of experiences ones, and even without reaching the consensus, deleting sourced information, that leads the article towards improvement and expanding. When the sourced content and edited by admins, a newcomer can reject and delete, how one can improve the article; it remains the stub article, which project does not encourage that. Here are the some edits for example from the edit history:

=== [[Talk:Bipartisan Report#rfc_7A29ACD|Talk:Bipartisan Report]] expired 2017-01-10 02:01 ===
* Id: 7A29ACD
* User: PCHS-NJROTC
* Date: 2016-12-11 01:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|756863993|MEDIA 756863993}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|756863995|POL 756863995}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|759247558|MEDIA 759247558}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|759247562|POL 759247562}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article was recently created by me, and shortly thereafter [[User:Bearcat]] disputed the neutrality of this article. Without discussion, an anonymous editor using [http://www.gogoair.com/ airplane Wi-Fi] proceeded to remove a lot of referenced information which he [[WP:IDONTLIKEIT|must not have liked]]. A neutral tone is important, and making the language a little less harsh is understandable, but removing referenced information is [[whitewashing]] and a general disservice to readers of Wikipedia. The overwhelming majority of sources criticize the website. [http://www.snopes.com/fox-news-benghazi-probe-hoax/ Snopes has debunked articles published by Bipartisan Report]. This website is documented in reliable sources as essentially being something ran out of someone's basement, using far-fetched headlines as [[click bait]], and the operator of the website doesn't even contest that. In my opinion, this article is not even worth keeping with only three sentences. The article, as it stands now, barely demonstrates [[WP:N|notability]], and it's debatable if it demonstrates it at all since this website is proof that anyone with an internet connected device can make a site "claiming" to be the world's largest newspaper, just as any 13 year old girl can claim to be the world's best soccer player on her Facebook page. I do believe, however, that the article met the requirements of inclusion prior to the reduction in content, as there were numerous [[WP:RS|sources]] cited. I propose reinstating the deleted material, but perhaps in a softer fashion. [[User:PCHS-NJROTC|<font color="red" face="Comic Sans MS">PCHS-NJROTC</font>]] <sup>[[User talk:PCHS-NJROTC|<font color="black" face="Comic Sans MS">(Messages)Growing tired of the bullshit day by day.</font>]]</sup> 01:42, 11 December 2016 (UTC)}}

Should the Glossary definition of "key article" state that the heraldic arms of a subject is a "key article" for a category about the subject? '''Proposal:''' The page title displayed in browser currently takes the form [title] - Wikipedia. I propose changing this to [title] — Wikipedia like [[:ru:|the Russian Wikipedia]], the French Wikipedia and the German Wikipedia, seeing as it looks better and makes more sense grammatically (hyphens are generally used to join words). === [[Talk:Sati (practice)#rfc_FCBA4F0|Talk:Sati (practice)]] expired 2017-01-12 10:01 ===
* Id: FCBA4F0
* User: Soham321
* Date: 2016-12-27 22:25:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|756963473|HIST 756963473}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|756963482|RELI 756963482}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|759638076|HIST 759638076}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|759638078|RELI 759638078}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The issue here is the following:
# Whether the views on sati of [[Charles James Napier|Sir Charles Napier]]  should be included in the article on Sati. (see history of article page for the deleted material)
# Whether the views on sati of the Mughal Emperor [[Akbar]] should be included in the article on Sati.(see history of article page for the deleted material)
# Whether the article is accurately reflecting the content of the [https://books.google.com/books?id=n7EYDAAAQBAJ&pg=PA73&source=gbs_toc_r&cad=4#v=onepage&q&f=false Banerjee book] in the 'Mughal Empire' section, or whether the article is containing edits which are not supported by the Banerjee book (see pages 81-2 for the relevant material on Sati).
# (related to point 3) Whether the alleged inaccuracies and distortions in the 'Mughal Empire' section tend to portray the Mughals in a poor light in a way  that is not supported by the source material (the Banerjee book).
# Whether the article is mixing up [[Jauhar]] with Sati in the "Mughal Empire" section in an unacceptable way. (This article is about Sati; there is a different WP article about Jauhar). 

[[User:Soham321|Soham321]] ([[User talk:Soham321|talk]]) 22:25, 27 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Murder of Maria Ladenburger#rfc_12E9E5E|Talk:Murder of Maria Ladenburger]] expired 2017-01-12 21:01 ===
* Id: 12E9E5E
* User: LucLeTruc
* Date: 2016-12-13 20:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|754673010|BIO 754673010}}

** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|759725473|BIO 759725473}}

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should this article about a recent rape crime in Germany include the following aspects disputed above:
# biographical aspects of the victim like her social engagement for Weltblick and rumours about work in refugee relief (which is, as of the current state of the investigation not directly linked to the crime) or place of birth
# biographical aspects of the victims father (name and profession)
# information about an obituary published by the victims family
# a possible connection to a rape that ocoured close by where the police currently largely rule out a connection
# a statement of chancellor Merkel to possibly ban the burqa which happened shortly afterwards
Please give opinions about the different aspects individually (i.e. include 1 - 3 but exclude the rest or similar). See the several open threads above for the detailed discussion. Thanks a lot. [[User:LucLeTruc|LucLeTruc]] ([[User talk:LucLeTruc|talk]]) 20:16, 13 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Andy Murray#rfc_CF10AE9|Talk:Andy Murray]] expired 2017-01-13 08:01 ===
* Id: CF10AE9
* User: Navops47
* Date: 2016-12-14 07:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|754746718|BIO 754746718}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|759810120|BIO 759810120}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 

Okay its time to settle this discussion we have not had an RFC to settle this question and I ask all editors to look at the guidelines for [[Wikipedia:Nationality of people from the United Kingdom|WP:Nationality of people from the United Kingdom]] and in relation to this RFC the sub section within that dealing with sport [[Wikipedia:Nationality_of_people_from_the_United_Kingdom#Guide_to_finding_UK_nationality|Guide to finding UK nationality/Sport]] you also need to read [[WP:Neutral_point_of_view#Due_and_undue_weight|WP:NPOV-Due and undue weight]] in determining your comments.

Currently we have a number of Editors in two camps those who feel that according to UK Nationality Guide section on Sport then we should be stating British tennis player first and references to his [[National identity]] second

For other Editors its the opposite way round preferring Scottish tennis player first references to British second. You will note in some of the examples that I have provided in relation to notable tennis players from the UK the leads are mixed if we are to follow the sports sub section guidelines in relation to this particular sport we need to ask are those being followed? Not just for this article but also the others. 

I would also ask that you look at the articles on [[Nationality]], [[Nation]], and [[National identity]] as they are quite different things and do your own research.

'''Options do we'''

'''Keep the lead as is''' (Andy Murray is a Scottish professional tennis player currently ranked world No. 1 in men's singles. Murray represents Great Britain...)  '''to avoid edit warring'''.

'''Change the lead to read per the guidelines interpretation to read.'''

# Andy Murray is a British tennis player from Scotland
# Andy Murray is a British tennis player born in Scotland
# Andy Murray is a Scottish born British tennis player

Editors are free to add other suggestions at any point my preference would be option one that is in line with the quotation example from Andy Murray and keeping in line with the national and international sport associations view that I provided please lets keep this discussion as civil as possible and be as balanced as you can.--[[User:Navops47|Navops47]] ([[User talk:Navops47|talk]]) 07:38, 14 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Deadmau5#rfc_81700E0|Talk:Deadmau5]] expired 2017-01-13 18:01 ===

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_C278B21|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2017-01-13 18:01 ===
* Id: C278B21
* User: Cordless Larry
* Date: 2017-01-08 19:17:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|759010691|SOC 759010691}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|759823056|POLICY 759823056}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|764231329|SOC 764231329}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|764231333|POLICY 764231333}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
According to [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Common outcomes#Schools]], commonly referred to by its abbreviated link [[WP:SCHOOLOUTCOMES]], "Most independently accredited degree-awarding institutions and high schools are usually kept ''except'' when zero [[Wikipedia:Independent sources|independent sources]] can be found to prove that the institution [[WP:HOAX|actually exists]]". However, a number of recent AfDs on secondary schools have closed either with no consensus or with consensus to delete. The closing summaries of two of these AfDs, [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Eden English School Btl]] and [[Wikipedia:Articles for deletion/Bal Vikash Secondary School]], have included recommendations that an RfC be held on the notability of secondary schools. Following discussion of this at [[Wikipedia talk:Articles for deletion/Common outcomes#Need for an RfC on schools' notability]], there is agreement to hold this RfC, with the following question:

'''Should secondary schools whose existence is verified by reliable, independent sources be presumed to be notable?''' [[User:Cordless Larry|Cordless Larry]] ([[User talk:Cordless Larry|talk]]) 19:17, 8 January 2017 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:New York#rfc_AF0A7E1|Talk:New York]] expired 2017-01-13 23:08 ===
* Id: AF0A7E1
* User: Jayron32
* Date: 2016-12-14 21:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|754860348|HIST 754860348}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|759931012|HIST 759931012}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Given that there is limited space in the lead to fully summarize an article, and also given that the lead, in the state it was in until I tried to make it better, featured almost 50% of the text solely about New York City and ignored most of the state, I pared down some of the more esoteric New York City information and added, to replace it, more information about New York State as a whole which was missing from the article.  It was called "vandalism" and reverted.  Which is, itself, an interesting definition of "vandalism" but I'd rather not get into that here.  Please consider, for the purpose of this RFC the narrow question of a) does the lead represented by [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=New_York&oldid=754801283 This version], which focuses mostly on New York City, or the lead represented by [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=New_York&direction=next&oldid=754801283 this version] which has roughly the same amount of text but changes the focus to New York State present a better version of the article.  I'm not even particularly attached to the exact wording here, just on the general question of should we or should we not alter the lead to focus on New York State more than New York City specifically.  Thanks for your contributions to this discussion. --[[User:Jayron32|<span style="color:#009">Jayron</span>]][[User talk:Jayron32|<b style="color:#090">''32''</b>]] 21:32, 14 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Maxinquaye#rfc_4F2F310|Talk:Maxinquaye]] expired 2017-01-14 16:01 ===
* Id: 4F2F310
* User: Gentlecollapse6
* Date: 2016-12-15 15:38:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|755006161|MEDIA 755006161}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|760034967|MEDIA 760034967}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Hey gang ([[User:Binksternet]], [[User:Greg Fasolino]], [[User:Ilovetopaint]], [[User:Drmies|Drmies]], [[User:Myxomatosis57]], [[User:OpenFuture]],), wondering if we can get some friendly moderation on this article, which has unfortunately degenerated into [[User:Dan56]]'s pet project over the last year or so. I've attempted to make positive contributions in the past, ranging from rephrasing sentences to adding subsections to altering quote choices, all which were all summarily reverted by Dan56 without convincing explanations beyond "I like my way better." IMO the lead is clumsily organized (release date in last paragraph? unconnected background info in the first paragraph? No context specific to the album i.e. how and where it was recorded until the second paragraph?), the writing in terms of style strikes me as is often tacky and indulgent in places (how many in-depth explanations from the artist's mouth do we need? some summarizing and restraint would be welcome in that department), some iffy quote interpolations, etc. Several other users ([[User:My name is not dave|My name is not dave]], [[User:Anne Delong|Anne Delong]]) have criticized Dan56 on the talk page for similar issues, as [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Maxinquaye#Encyclopedic_style_and_neutral_point_of_view.3F you] can [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Talk:Maxinquaye#Recent_revision_to_the_lead see], but he's simply dismissed them and held up the article's Good Article status as sufficient validation of his efforts—user my name is not dave nonetheless only approved the article with the following caveat: "It seems to be a matter of taste when it comes to the lead, I think we've gone past the stage of convincing each other, so better hold it there." Any thoughts on all this would be welcome. [[User:Gentlecollapse6|GentleCollapse16]] ([[User talk:Gentlecollapse6|talk]]) 15:38, 15 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Death of JonBenét Ramsey#rfc_399144D|Talk:Death of JonBenét Ramsey]] expired 2017-01-16 04:01 ===
* Id: 399144D
* User: Flyer22 Reborn
* Date: 2016-12-18 01:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|755446150|BIO 755446150}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|755446153|MEDIA 755446153}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|755446159|SOC 755446159}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|760451401|BIO 760451401}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|760451406|MEDIA 760451406}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|760451411|SOC 760451411}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This RfC is an extension of the [[Talk:Death of JonBenét Ramsey#I have removed "Murder" references]] discussion on the talk page, which is an extension of a recent move discussion. '''One view''' is that use of the word ''murder'' within the article is against the [[WP:NPOV]] policy since "the result of the Request to Move was that this article should be called 'Death of..' not 'Murder of...' because the theory that JonBenét was murdered, while plausible, is not the only plausible theory accepted by reliable sources. There is a substantial body of respectable thought that she was the victim of an accidental killing." Because of this view, it is argued that we also cannot use murder categories in the article. '''The other view''' is that the rationale for moving the article is flawed because the WP:NPOV policy, especially its [[WP:Due weight]] section, is about giving most of our weight to what the majority of reliable sources state. The vast majority of reliable sources call JonBenét Ramsey's death a murder. Therefore, stating that she was murdered and/or using "murder" categories is not a violation of the WP:NPOV policy. Furthermore, as has been noted before, [[murder]] is not always intentional. 

I will alert related WikiProjects to this RfC, editors at [[Wikipedia talk:Neutral point of view]], [[Wikipedia talk:Article titles]] and [[Wikipedia talk:Verifiability]], and editors at <Strike>[[WP:Village pump (policy)]]</Strike> [[WP:Village pump (miscellaneous)]] (Village pump (policy) is not for dispute issues.) [[User:Flyer22 Reborn|Flyer22 Reborn]] ([[User talk:Flyer22 Reborn|talk]]) 01:40, 18 December 2016 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:Death of JonBenét Ramsey#rfc_D333C96|Talk:Death of JonBenét Ramsey]] expired 2017-01-16 04:01 ===
* Id: D333C96
* User: CaroleHenson
* Date: 2016-12-17 03:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|755273621|BIO 755273621}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|755273625|SOC 755273625}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|760300392|BIO 760300392}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|760300397|SOC 760300397}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There have been ongoing discussions about the use of "death" or "murder" in the [[Death of JonBenét Ramsey]] article. One perspective is that it is routinely, or nearly always, called a murder in the press - and was a murder. Another is that there has not been a conviction, and so use of the word "murder" is presumptuous. This also relates to whether the [[Death_of_JonBenét_Ramsey#Family_member_theory|family member theory]] section is appropriate for the article. (i.e., the question of murder vs. homicide isn't just related to a family member scenario), but there are some that believe that section is not appropriate for the article. So, the questions are: Is "murder" an appropriate word to use in the article? 2) Is the family member theory section inappropriate for the article? Your input will be much appreciated!--<span style="font-family:Segoe print; color:#CC4E5C; text-shadow:gray 0.2em 0.2em 0.4em;">[[User:CaroleHenson|CaroleHenson]] [[User talk:CaroleHenson|''(talk)'']]</span> 03:43, 17 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion#rfc_912903C|Wikipedia talk:Criteria for speedy deletion]] expired 2017-01-16 22:01 ===
* Id: 912903C
* User: Adam9007
* Date: 2017-01-16 17:12:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|760387662|POLICY 760387662}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|760387665|PROP 760387665}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|760422439|POLICY 760422439}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|760422443|PROP 760422443}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
As most editors think tourist attractions are organisations (They are not as far as I can tell. They are places; I checked the categories), unless there's something I'm missing (I didn't see anything in [[:Category:Organizations]] that could have anything to do with tourist attractions), I'm proposing an extension of A7 to explicitly cover tourist attractions and similar places. This will certainly make life easier for everyone, especially editors like myself who go by the categories in determining what a subject is. If I am missing something, then I think an addition to the wording of the templates is necessary to make it clearer. [[User:Adam9007|Adam9007]] ([[User talk:Adam9007|talk]]) 17:12, 16 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Film#rfc_E055192|Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Film]] expired 2017-01-17 01:01 ===
* Id: E055192
* User: AndrewOne
* Date: 2016-12-22 19:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|756220805|MEDIA 756220805}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|760444757|MEDIA 760444757}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This request for comments has been created in order to determine whether or not the two main lists of ''They Shoot Pictures, Don't They'' (theyshootpictures.com, sometimes known as "TSPDT") – The 1,000 Greatest Films and The 21st Century's Most Acclaimed Films – should be regarded as reliable sources on how celebrated a film is among film critics and scholars. There is a discussion about this subject in the above talk page section "[[Wikipedia talk:WikiProject Film#On TSPDT]]". Vote "'''Yes'''" if you consider the site's two main lists appropriate for being mentioned on Wikipedia, and "'''No'''" if you consider them unreliable. [[User:AndrewOne|AndrewOne]] ([[User talk:AndrewOne|talk]]) 19:14, 22 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Radha Madhav Dham#rfc_F5F2956|Talk:Radha Madhav Dham]] expired 2017-01-17 01:01 ===
* Id: F5F2956
* User: Grayfell
* Date: 2016-12-17 23:28:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|755430989|RELI 755430989}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|760444758|RELI 760444758}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Radha Madhav Dham is a Hindu temple in Hays County Texas. Should it be mentioned that in 2013 at least one invocation (prayer) was given by Diwakari Devi, the leader of this temple, to the Hays County Commissioners Court?
This information is supported by the court's own [http://hays.granicus.com/DocumentViewer.php?file=hays_9b090e4b-6e90-46ca-bdf3-5ef7d6dc4a12.pdf routine minutes] (and the court's [http://hays.granicus.com/MediaPlayer.php?view_id=2&clip_id=56 video of the meeting], which includes the invocation), and two additional sources:
* Hankins, L.W. 2013. [http://smmercury.com/2013/10/23/freethought-san-marcos-part-2-how-hays-county-government-promotes-religion/ ''How Hays County government promotes religion''] - This is an opinion by a lawyer in the ''[[San Marcos Mercury]]'' a local paper or website. The article mainly deals with 1st Amendment issues and mentions the temple briefly, but not by name. This opinion appears to have been [http://www.texasfreethoughtjournal.net/article/how-hays-county-government-promotes-religion-part-2 republished] from The Texas Freethought Journal, which appears to be name the lawyer uses for his own blog.
*''Diwakari Devi of Radha Madhav Dham gives Invocation at Hays County Court''. [http://archive.li/FElsF#selection-167.0-167.72 archived link] from ''[[The Vrindavan Times]]'' which now appears defunct but was a paper or website serving [[Vrindavan]], the town in India which is the location of the temple's organization, [[Jagadguru Kripalu Parishat|JKP]]. I cannot find enough information on this source to confidently assess its reliability, but it appears to be affiliated with the JKP.

The argument above has been exceedingly long, but 
*Points for inclusion are:
:That it helps establish that the temple is still active after changing its name in 2012 following an unrelated controversy
:Without this, there would be nothing listed in the history section following 2012 
:That it's of interest as part of the temple's history, and that a Hindu invocation in a Texas court is itself noteworthy
::(I have listed my extensive arguments below (will try to make in more concise soon)  )
*Points against are:
:The sources are poor for establishing this as being historically significant or noteworthy, as they are either involved or passing mentions. 
:The sources may not be entirely reliable. 
:Inclusion of this detail may be considered promotional, since it's adding length by including a routine detail outside of due weight.

The temple's recent history immediately prior to this invocation is very controversial for unrelated reasons explained in the article and at [[Prakashanand Saraswati]]. This doesn't reflect on this invocation other than as, mentioned above, an indicator of continuing activity. The majority of useful sources I found are about that controversy. The remainder were mostly routine event listings and similar or comments about size and architecture of the temple. I did not find any other usable sources mentioning this invocation. [[User:Grayfell|Grayfell]] ([[User talk:Grayfell|talk]]) 23:28, 17 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Milky Way#rfc_96E821D|Talk:Milky Way]] expired 2017-01-17 11:01 ===

=== [[Talk:British Empire#rfc_DF8B8D0|Talk:British Empire]] expired 2017-01-17 14:01 ===
* Id: DF8B8D0
* User: N0n3up
* Date: 2017-01-17 06:41:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|760480633|UNSORTED 760480633}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|760516643|UNSORTED 760516643}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should "[[Laissez-faire]]" be linked to it's article in the lead? "Laissez-faire" is found nowhere in the page and vital to better understand the article since not many people might understand french terms for economic systems, not really an overlink in my opinion. [[User:N0n3up|N0n3up]] ([[User talk:N0n3up|talk]]) 06:41, 17 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Mary Catherine Lamb#rfc_68F1EA6|Talk:Mary Catherine Lamb]] expired 2017-01-17 22:01 ===
* Id: 68F1EA6
* User: Ailemadrah
* Date: 2017-01-17 18:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|760566817|TECH 760566817}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|760583382|TECH 760583382}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
 Problems with two-part last names in citations '''

While improving the citations in this article, I ran into a problem that brought me to a halt. One of the sources has the last name "Van Flandern," and when I entered that name as a "ref name" before the citation, I kept getting an error message stating that there were "too many names" in the reference. Thanks to a sudden flash of insight, I condensed the ref name from "Van Flandern" to "VanFlandern," and that solved the immediate problem. (There was no problem entering "Van Flandern" in the actual citation, using the citation template for a magazine article.)

However, this is a glitch in the system and really does need to be fixed! I hate to think how many other people have had the same immensely frustrating experience. BTW, the template section has no wisdom to offer on this issue.

To make sure this comment is as clear as possible, here are the two versions of the reference, first the one that got the error message, then the one that was accepted:

<ref name=Van Flandern>{{citation |last=Van Flandern ... [if I write the entire citation, it doesn't show up here]

<ref name=VanFlandern>{{citation |last=Van Flandern ... [again, I can't enter the entire citation – it incorrectly becomes a citation for this comment]

(This strikes me as yet another glitch...)

Thanks in advance to anyone who can fix this![[User:Ailemadrah|Ailemadrah]] ([[User talk:Ailemadrah|talk]]) 18:01, 17 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)#rfc_18D22CB|Wikipedia:Village pump (proposals)]] expired 2017-01-18 21:01 ===
* Id: 18D22CB
* User: Ad Orientem
* Date: 2017-01-02 15:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|757937854|POLICY 757937854}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|757937857|PROP 757937857}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|760745724|POLICY 760745724}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|760745727|PROP 760745727}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
</nowiki>
'''Proposal''': A7 <s>and G11</s> CSD tags should not be applied to new articles within the first 30 minutes of creation and that the templates be modified to alert editors when they are being applied too hastily. When templates are improperly applied too quickly to newly created articles they should be ignored and or removed. This proposal does not affect other CSD tags which may still be applied as needed. The CSD guidelines shall be modified to reflect this change upon adoption by the community. 

'''Rationale''': Tag bombing newly created articles within minutes, and sometimes seconds of creation appears to be a recurring problem. There have been instances where this has been done to new editors working on their first article and I can imagine how discouraging it must be. Giving editors a chance to flesh out their new article to demonstrate the notability of the subject and ensure that the language is NPOV compliant before nominating for speedy deletion does not strike me as a threat to the integrity of the project. -[[User:Ad Orientem|Ad Orientem]] ([[User talk:Ad Orientem|talk]]) 15:48, 2 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Silicon Alley#rfc_9445B8A|Talk:Silicon Alley]] expired 2017-01-19 04:02 ===
* Id: 9445B8A
* User: Jytdog
* Date: 2016-12-20 03:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|755779607|ECON 755779607}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|755779609|SCI 755779609}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|760801040|ECON 760801040}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|760801043|SCI 760801043}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This article currently contains discussion of the biotech industry.  That content was added in [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Silicon_Alley&type=revision&diff=619427054&oldid=619170945 this diff] by [[User:Castncoot]].

I attempted to remove that in [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Silicon_Alley&type=revision&diff=747316792&oldid=747305588 this diffl] on Nov 1; this was reverted by Castncoot [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Silicon_Alley&diff=next&oldid=747316792 here].  

This article has few watchers, so it has mostly been Castncoot and I bumping heads.   After several failed efforts to get community input to resolve this dispute (above;  [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Wikipedia:No_original_research/Noticeboard&oldid=755323995#Another_business_thing ORN]; at Talk:Biotechnology [[Talk:Biotechnology#Comparison_of_terminology:_.22Biotechnology.22_vs_.22Technology.22|here]], and an attempt at formal mediation [[Wikipedia:Requests for mediation/Silicon Alley|here]], the only way I can see to resolve this is an RfC. 

The crux of the dispute as I understand it is:
* Castncoot understands that because biotechnology is a form of technology, any discussion of "technology" anywhere in Wikipedia also should include "biotechnology", and likewise any discussion of the "tech industry" by default should include the "biotech industry".  That includes this article.  For Castncoot this is a "blue sky" obvious thing. 
* In my understanding, the reliable sources about Silicon Alley discuss it as a cluster of companies in the "tech industry" and use that term to refer to "companies that work in the IT/digital/software space";  the refs about Silicon Alley don't discuss biotech companies, and refs about the biotech industry in NYC don't associate it with Silicon Alley.  (For refs, see the section above, [[Talk:Silicon_Alley#Refs_galore_that_tech_and_biotech_industries_are_distinct_in_general_and_wrt_Silicon_Alley|here]], which are not cited in the article now.)  

The question: '''Should this article include discussion of the biotech industry?''' [[User:Jytdog|Jytdog]] ([[User talk:Jytdog|talk]]) 03:52, 20 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Syrian Observatory for Human Rights#rfc_C785C75|Talk:Syrian Observatory for Human Rights]] expired 2017-01-19 06:01 ===
* Id: C785C75
* User: EtienneDolet
* Date: 2016-12-20 05:52:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|755792235|POL 755792235}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|760813249|POL 760813249}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the terms "pro-opposition" or "anti-Assad" be used to describe the SOHR in the lead sentence?

As in: 
{{quotation|The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, founded in May 2006, is a UK-based '''pro-opposition (and/or) anti-Assad''' information office that has been documenting human rights abuses in Syria which has focused since 2011 on the Syrian Civil War.}}

*Sources that describe it as '''pro-opposition''' include: [http://world.time.com/2014/02/17/report-almost-6000-dead-in-syria-during-geneva-talks/ Time], [http://www.independent.co.uk/voices/commentators/syrian-civil-war-jabhat-al-nusras-massacre-of-druze-villagers-shows-the-group-is-just-as-nasty-as-10318348.html Independent], [http://www.reuters.com/article/us-syria-crisis-torture-idUSBRE9380VI20130409 Reuters], [http://www.bbc.com/news/world-middle-east-23600612 BBC], [http://www.voanews.com/a/syrian_opposition_group_condemns_rebel_unit_for_torture/1638083.html VOA], [http://www.rferl.org/a/syria/25215280.html Radio Free Europe/Radio Liberty], [https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2013-05-30/assad-gets-s-300-shipment-from-russia-as-israel-boost-defenses Bloomberg], [http://www.ibtimes.com/mccain-visits-syrian-rebels-europeans-cant-decide-aid-1279883 International Business Times], [http://www.dw.com/en/syria-barrel-bombs-leave-dozens-dead-in-aleppo-airstrikes/a-17328847 Deutsche Welle], [http://www.skynews.com.au/news/world/mideast/2016/05/22/at-least-60-thousand-killed-in-syrian-jails.html Sky News], [http://www.express.co.uk/news/world/407802/Is-Syria-on-the-path-to-bloody-British-and-American-intervention Express], [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2013/oct/19/syria-soldiers-killed-damascus-suicide-bombing Guardian], [http://www.jpost.com/printarticle.aspx?id=316623 Jerusalem Post].

*Sources that describe it '''anti-Assad''' include: [http://www.cnn.com/2015/10/07/middleeast/russia-syria-isis/ CNN], [http://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2015/10/14/isil-fights-syrian-rebels-near-aleppo-as-army-prepares-assault.html Al-Jazeera], [http://www.haaretz.com/news/middle-east/1.580112 Haaretz], [http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2515026/Al-Qaeda-militants-filmed-executing-rival-Syrian-rebel-faction.html Daily Mail], [http://www.dailystar.com.lb/News/Middle-East/2013/Dec-09/240426-hard-to-remove-all-chemical-weapons-from-syria-by-dec-31-opcw.ashx#ixzz2uyYQTkse The Daily Star].

P.S. If you stumble on any more sources, let me know and I'll add it. [[User:EtienneDolet|Étienne Dolet]] ([[User talk:EtienneDolet|talk]]) 05:52, 20 December 2016 (UTC)}}

* RFC Text:



=== [[Wikipedia talk:Copyrights#rfc_24EB701|Wikipedia talk:Copyrights]] expired 2017-01-20 20:01 ===
* Id: 24EB701
* User: Ramaksoud2000
* Date: 2016-12-21 23:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|756096634|POLICY 756096634}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|756096636|PROP 756096636}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|761084640|POLICY 761084640}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|761084641|PROP 761084641}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently, the following countries do not have copyright relations with the U.S.: Eritrea, Ethiopia, Iran, Iraq, and San Marino. These countries do not recognize U.S. copyright, and the U.S. does not recognize their copyright. All work created by a resident of those countries, and published in those countries, is public domain in the United States, and much of the world. [[WP:C]] currently states: {{quote|The Wikimedia Foundation is based in the United States and accordingly governed by United States copyright law. Regardless, according to Jimbo Wales, the co-founder of Wikipedia, Wikipedia contributors should respect the copyright law of other nations, even if these do not have official copyright relations with the United States.}} And [[Wikipedia:Non-U.S. copyrights]] currently states: {{quote|It is longstanding Wikipedia policy to respect the copyright law of other nations, even if these do not have official copyright relations with the United States. What this means in practice is determined case by case, bearing in mind the goal of being able to freely distribute Wikipedia in the country an incorporated work originates from.}} The [[Wikipedia_talk:Copyrights/Archive_14#RfC:_What_to_do_with_respect_to_the_copyright_of_countries_with_which_the_US_does_not_have_copyright_relations.3F|last RfC]] on whether or not the English Wikipedia should host such content was 4.5 years ago and was closed with no consensus for the status quo, and no consensus for change. '''Should the English Wikipedia host content that is public domain in the United States because the country of origin does not have copyright relations with the U.S.?''' [[User:Ramaksoud2000|Ramaksoud2000]] <sup>('''[[User talk:Ramaksoud2000|Talk to me]]''')</sup>  23:06, 21 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_C154096|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2017-01-21 00:03 ===
* Id: C154096
* User: Majora
* Date: 2016-12-28 22:30:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|757124019|POLICY 757124019}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|757335798|PROP 757335798}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|761113982|POLICY 761113982}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|761113983|PROP 761113983}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This already happens a little bit but there has been no actual community grant to allow this to happen. TFD already allows this per [[WP:BADNAC]]. Due to the extremely low participation at FFD and the even lower admin participation I would like to have the community grant non-admins the ability to close FFD discussions as delete. Afterwards the {{tl|db-xfd}} template would be used on the file page to indicate that the image is ready for deletion. This would massively help reduce the backlog by allowing competent individuals who have a handle on file maintenance tasks the ability to close discussions in this manner. Of course, the deleting administrator would be responsible for double checking but with discussions that are still open from August I don't see any other alternative.<p>Note: I have posted a notice on [[WT:FFD]] and will be posting this to [[T:CENT]] in a moment. --[[User:Majora|Majora]] ([[User talk:Majora|talk]]) 22:30, 28 December 2016 (UTC)}}

It seems the question here is "Move or Merge with Race for the Case" vs. "Oppose". I would then from my very basic understanding "weak oppose" the move/merge, as they seem similar but different brands. I took the liberty of sorting the RFC into media and soc.--[[User:Dwarf Kirlston]] - [[User Talk:Dwarf Kirlston|talk]] 04:02, 21 January 2017 (UTC)}}

The question is, should the "Controversy over hate group and extremist listings" section of the SPLC's wiki article include public criticisms of the SPLC's hate group list, by Israeli Ambassador to the US, [[Ron Dermer]].  The text of the speech can be found on Ambassador Dermer's official Facebook page, where he posted the text. [https://www.facebook.com/ambdermer/photos/a.1451178395107841.1073741826.1450515471840800/2157389601153380/?type=3&theater]-

The speech was reported on by numerous publications, including Politico [http://www.politico.com/story/2016/12/israel-dermer-frank-gaffney-232651], Buzzfeed[https://www.buzzfeed.com/talalansari/israeli-ambassador-to-us-got-award-from-anti-muslim-group?utm_term=.ryO6XaVlLv#.ecNGnANdm9], The Jerusalem Post[http://www.jpost.com/Diaspora/Israeli-Ambassador-to-the-US-slams-group-for-attacking-anti-Islamist-activists-475553], The Times of Israel[http://www.timesofisrael.com/defending-anti-muslim-group-envoy-to-us-slams-racism-watchdog/], Haaretz [http://www.haaretz.com/us-news/1.759186], Breitbart [http://www.breitbart.com/jerusalem/2016/12/15/israeli-ambassador-ron-dermer-slams-southern-poverty-law-center-defamers-blacklisters/], Washington Free Beacon [http://freebeacon.com/national-security/israeli-ambassador-iran-nuclear-weapons-less-10-years/], The Forward [http://forward.com/news/breaking-news/357102/israeli-ambassador-accepts-award-from-anti-islam-extremist-rejects-civil-ri/], as well as several other news outlets. 

For citation purposes on Wikipedia, JPost, Politico, and Haaretz would be considered the [[WP:RS | reliable sources]] for citation. [[User:The Armchair General|TAG]] ([[User talk:The Armchair General|talk]]) 18:06, 22 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Anatole Klyosov#rfc_5828C58|Talk:Anatole Klyosov]] expired 2017-01-26 00:03 ===
* Id: 5828C58
* User: JoyceWood
* Date: 2017-01-12 19:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|759716340|BIO 759716340}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|759716343|SCI 759716343}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|761984040|BIO 761984040}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|761984042|SCI 761984042}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the quoted paragraph replace the current paragraph?

{{Quotation2|From 2008 Klyosov is also known as the author of what he calls "DNA genealogy", a "new science" which implements methods of chemical kinetics in population genetics and synthesizes them with anthropology, linguistics and archaeology. Klyosov described his "DNA genealogy" as a "patriotic science". Between 2010 and 2016 Klyosov published 10 books in the field, in which he made "outlandish claims". In some of his journal publications Klyosov tried to refute the Out of Africa hypothesis and proposed his alternative Into Africa theory. According to a group of Russian scientists from various fields, "DNA genealogy" is pseudoscience and has been characterized as "DNA demagoguery".}} --[[User:JoyceWood|JoyceWood]] ([[User talk:JoyceWood|talk]]) 19:21, 12 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Neopalpa donaldtrumpi#rfc_A9C7E05|Talk:Neopalpa donaldtrumpi]] expired 2017-01-27 01:01 ===
* Id: A9C7E05
* User: Staszek Lem
* Date: 2017-01-26 00:24:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|761999607|SCI 761999607}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|762158173|SCI 762158173}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Is male genitalia size the single most prominent feature and only it must be included in the description of genitalia, the rest being "too technical" and unimportant? [[User:Staszek Lem|Staszek Lem]] ([[User talk:Staszek Lem|talk]]) 00:24, 26 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Christmas#rfc_792100F|Talk:Christmas]] expired 2017-01-27 01:01 ===
* Id: 792100F
* User: Davey2010
* Date: 2016-12-27 23:34:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|757043244|RELI 757043244}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|757043245|SOC 757043245}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Religion_and_philosophy|prev|762158175|RELI 762158175}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|762158176|SOC 762158176}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the article date formats be in YMD only, MDY only, DMY only, or reverted back to December 2015 when there was both ?

--<br />

Hi, Long story short back in December {{noping|Kind Tennis Fan}} had converted the entire article to MDY[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Christmas&diff=695844019&oldid=695605220] - There was no consensus for this nor was there any discussion, So having seen Walter Görlitz convert all dates to MDY I then had converted everything to YMD, Since then there's been a disagreement/edit war over this so I wanted to get a wider discussion as to what should be used or done,<br />
I had attempted to revert back to Dec 2015 and readd all of the edits however it would've took forever and was way too much so I had self-reverted and decided to start an RFC, Thanks, –[[User:Davey2010|<span style="color:#147A44;">'''Davey'''</span><span style="color:#C4061C;">'''2010'''</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:Davey2010|<span style="color:#147A44;">Merry Xmas</span> / <span style="color:#C4061C;">Happy New Year</span>]]</sup> 23:34, 27 December 2016 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
There is a content dispute about adding ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Saudi_Arabia&diff=756901261&oldid=756866023 diff]) the following sentence to the article
{{talkquote|The land of the present-day Saudi Arabia is the birthplace of Islam and Arabness.}}
Previous discussions ([https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Talk:Saudi_Arabia&oldid=756980626#The_land_of_the_present-day_Saudi_Arabia_is_the_birthplace_of_Islam_and_Arabs here] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=User_talk:A%E1%B9%ADlas&oldid=756928692#Hello here]) have been inconclusive and this could benefit from input from other editors. The specific question of this RFC is <u>Should the above (quoted) sentence be added to the article</u> Please answer as
*'''Yes''' (Mention where to add, lead or any body section)
*'''No'''
*'''Other''' (any other solution)
Please post your !vote in the "!vote" section along with a brief explanation, but ''keep any threaded discussions in the "Discussion" section''. Thank you. --[[User:Lemongirl942|Lemongirl942]] ([[User talk:Lemongirl942|talk]]) 01:52, 28 December 2016 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the artist list be removed entirely or should it contain only acceptable artists? I think the artists section should only consist of artists that have released at least one song with the label and should be included with a verifiable source. Currently, random users have been adding artists to the list and there are no reliable secondary sources exclusively about the artist list. The only available source about the artists is the one published by the label itself. - <font style="padding:1px 2px;background:#ADE6E1;border:1px solid"><font color="black">'''The'''</font></font><font style="padding:1px 5px;background:black;">[[user talk:TheMagnificentist|<font color="ADE6E1">Magnificentist</font>]]</font> 17:59, 28 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Legal tender#rfc_237E67A|Talk:Legal tender]] expired 2017-01-27 19:01 ===
* Id: 237E67A
* User: 2601:140:C004:83B0:1425:8B7F:AA76:A135
* Date: 2017-01-27 15:55:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|762252849|ECON 762252849}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|762268234|ECON 762268234}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
:The [[Legal Tender Cases]] were done because there were groups in the South that refused to accept the dollar. The Supreme Court later found that the dollar is legal tender and cannot be refused by anyone for payments within the United States. That was to ensure that the confederates could not reject the currency or start their own. No other currency is legal tender so it cannot be legally required to be accepted or paid with. Sources not saying this are original research or fringe because they disagree with the Supreme Court, which is the only arbitrary of Constitutionality in the United States. [[Special:Contributions/2601:140:C004:83B0:1425:8B7F:AA76:A135|2601:140:C004:83B0:1425:8B7F:AA76:A135]] ([[User talk:2601:140:C004:83B0:1425:8B7F:AA76:A135|talk]]) 15:55, 27 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of common misconceptions#rfc_48AAAE0|Talk:List of common misconceptions]] expired 2017-01-28 21:01 ===
* Id: 48AAAE0
* User: Herostratus

* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the [[List of common misconceptions#Christianity and Judaism|Christianity and Judaism]] contain this entry:
:{{xt| The doctrine of the [[trinity]] and the word itself are nowhere to be found in the Bible. The concept was developed by the church fathers in the 4th and 5th centuries.}}
with these being the current refs:
*The Oxford Companion to the Bible, Bruce Metzger and Michael Coogan, editors, 1993, “Trinity,” p. 782 - "Because the Trinity is such an important part of later Christian doctrine, it is striking that the term does not appear in the New Testament. Likewise, the developed concept of three coequal partners in the Godhead found in later creedal formulations cannot be clearly detected within the confines of the canon [i.e., actual Scripture]”.
*The International Standard Bible Encyclopedia, 1988, Vol. 4, “Trinity,” p. 914</ref><ref>The HarperCollins Bible Dictionary, Paul Achtemeier, editor, 1996, “Trinity”.
*The HarperCollins Encyclopedia of Catholicism, Richard McBrien, general editor, 1995, “God,” pp. 564-565
*The New Encyclopaedia Britannica, 1985 edition, Micropaedia, Vol. 11, p. 928.
*The New International Dictionary of New Testament Theology, Colin Brown, editor, Vol. 2, 1976, “God,” p. 84.
*Reproduced in The Sermons of Martin Luther, John Lenker, editor, Vol. 3, 1988, p. 406
*McGrath, Alister E. Christian Theology: An Introduction Blackwell, Oxford (2001) p.324 [[User:Herostratus|Herostratus]] ([[User talk:Herostratus|talk]]) 20:54, 29 December 2016 (UTC)}}

=== [[Template talk:US Presidential Administrations#rfc_0D2352F|Template talk:US Presidential Administrations]] expired 2017-01-29 10:01 ===
* Id: 0D2352F
* User: Neve-selbert
* Date: 2017-01-23 04:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|761477036|HIST 761477036}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|761477041|POL 761477041}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|762524534|HIST 762524534}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|762524538|POL 762524538}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should we keep the current design of this template concerning the presidencies of the United States, or consider a redesign? The issue was discussed above but without a consensus, with one user ({{u|Marbe166}}) in favour and one ({{u|Drdpw}}) opposed. The reason why I feel the template should be revamped is rather straightforward; it looks more or less like a copy of {{tl|US Presidents}} (with only terms of office to set them both apart), and a redesign would help differentiate it from that template and give it its own sort of feel. Furthermore, I chose to separate the presidents by era (rather than by century or whatnot) given that many regard the Civil War, WW2 and the Cold War as pivotal epochs in American history. Thoughts are much welcome.--[[User:Neve-selbert|Nev&eacute;]][[Special:Contributions/Neve-selbert|&ndash;]][[User talk:Neve-selbert|selbert]] 04:07, 23 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Raymond Chan Chi-chuen#rfc_28A69DC|Talk:Raymond Chan Chi-chuen]] expired 2017-01-29 14:01 ===
* Id: 28A69DC
* User: George Ho
* Date: 2017-01-02 03:26:00

<u>Currently, "Chan Chi-chuen" is used.</u> <u>Edit:</u> However, previous revisions show frequent changes on the name. At the beginning, [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Raymond_Chan_Chi-chuen&oldid=506960865 Ray Chan Chi-chuen] was used. This year, the name changed to [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Raymond_Chan_Chi-chuen&oldid=740941811 Ray Chan] and then to [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Raymond_Chan_Chi-chuen&diff=next&oldid=744041541 Chan Chi-chuen].

=== [[Talk:Intelligent design#rfc_9714937|Talk:Intelligent design]] expired 2017-01-29 21:01 ===
* Id: 9714937
* User: Jytdog
* Date: 2017-01-22 04:10:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|761306111|SCI 761306111}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|762614944|SCI 762614944}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The current 1st paragraph of the lead says (with very extensive referencing removed and with the word "pseudoscientific" bolded):

* '''Current version''':   Intelligent design (ID) is the '''pseudoscientific''' view that "certain features of the universe and of living things are best explained by an intelligent cause, not an undirected process such as natural selection."  Educators, philosophers, and the scientific community have demonstrated that ID is a religious argument, a form of creationism which lacks empirical support and offers no testable or tenable hypotheses. Proponents argue that it is "an evidence-based scientific theory about life's origins" that challenges the methodological naturalism inherent in modern science, while conceding that they have yet to produce a scientific theory. The leading proponents of ID are associated with the Discovery Institute, a politically conservative think tank based in the United States.  Although they state that ID is not creationism and deliberately avoid assigning a personality to the designer, many of these proponents express belief that the designer is the Christian deity.

People have expressed a desire to change the '''style''' so that the word "pseudoscience" appears a) later, and b) as a noun instead of an adjective. 

*'''Alternative 1''':   Intelligent design (ID) is the view that "certain features of the universe and of living things are best explained by an intelligent cause, not an undirected process such as natural selection." Intelligent design is '''pseudoscience''', with educators, philosophers, and the scientific community having demonstrated that ID is '''not science but''' a religious argument, a form of creationism which lacks empirical support and offers no testable or tenable hypotheses. Proponents argue that it is "an evidence-based scientific theory about life's origins" that challenges the methodological naturalism inherent in modern science, while conceding that they have yet to produce a scientific theory. The leading proponents of ID are associated with the Discovery Institute, a politically conservative think tank based in the United States.  Although they state that ID is not creationism and deliberately avoid assigning a personality to the designer, many of these proponents express belief that the designer is the Christian deity.

*'''Alternative 2''': Intelligent design (ID) is the view that "certain features of the universe and of living things are best explained by an intelligent cause, not an undirected process such as natural selection."  The leading proponents of ID are associated with the Discovery Institute, a politically conservative think tank based in the United States.  Although they state that ID is not creationism and deliberately avoid assigning a personality to the designer, many of these proponents express belief that the designer is the Christian deity. Proponents argue that ID is "an evidence-based scientific theory about life's origins" that challenges the methodological naturalism inherent in modern science, yet concede that they have yet to produce a scientific theory. Educators, philosophers, and the scientific community have demonstrated that ID is a religious argument constituting a form of creationism which lacks empirical support and offers no testable or tenable hypotheses. As such, ID is '''pseudoscience'''.

This RfC is focused only on the arrangement of existing content, not adding or removing any words or sources. Relevant policies/guidelines include [[WP:PSCI]], [[WP:FRINGE]], and [[WP:LEAD]].

Please !vote for a version in the designated section, and discuss in the section below.  It would be most helpful for the closer if you put responses to !votes in the discussion section and kept the !votes free of clutter.

Please also be mindful of the DS on this topic and of [[WP:SOAP]]. [[User:Jytdog|Jytdog]] ([[User talk:Jytdog|talk]]) 04:10, 22 January 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:William McKinley#rfc_7585EF3|Talk:William McKinley]] expired 2017-01-30 15:01 ===
* Id: 7585EF3
* User: Lx 121
* Date: 2017-01-03 20:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|758171915|BIO 758171915}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|758171916|HIST 758171916}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|758171924|POL 758171924}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|758171926|SOC 758171926}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|762751013|BIO 762751013}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|762751015|HIST 762751015}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|762751020|POL 762751020}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|762751023|SOC 762751023}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
:*'''tl;dr''' =  This bio has used a ''photo'' of subject as lede, ''since it was created.''  There are ''ample'' photographs to choose from.  ''Every other'' presidential bio for ~175 years (before + after) uses ''photos'' of the subject as lede.  Recently, 2 users with a "pointy" objective have decided to force the use of a painting as lede, citing a nonexistent & [[wp:npov]] "official white house portrait" -rule, & a thesis that "paintings are better".
::& are completely {{Linktext|intransigent}} in their positions & impervious to discussion, wp, or evidence of prior consensus.
::I am "outnumbered" & out of "reverts"; all off which these 2 users are "tactically aware" of.  i am also ''extremely'' fed up with re-arguing this point with the same editors, time after time.
::So, other history/biography/pol-sci editors need to get involved here.
::[[User:Lx 121|Lx 121]] ([[User talk:Lx 121|talk]]) 20:27, 3 January 2017 (UTC)}}
