** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|771140369|SOC 771140369}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following content be added to the article?
<blockquote>The Smith & Wesson M&P15 was used in the [[2012 Aurora shooting]],<ref name=time20121204>{{cite news |magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |url=http://newsfeed.time.com/2012/12/04/top-10-news-lists/slide/the-dark-knight-rises-massacre/ |title=Top 10 Crime Stories: 2. The Dark Knight Rises Massacre |first=Madison |last=Gray |date=December 4, 2012 |accessdate=February 28, 2017 |quote=He reportedly threw a noxious gas bomb into the auditorium, then brandishing a Smith & Wesson M&P 15 rifle, a Remington 870 Express Tactical shotgun and two Glock 22 handguns, opened fire, killed 12 people and wounded 58.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2012/07/24/us/aurora-gunmans-lethal-arsenal.html |title=Aurora Gunman's Arsenal: Shotgun, Semiautomatic Rifle and, at the End, a Pistol |accessdate=February 28, 2017 |first=James |last=Dao |date=July 23, 2012 |quote=Without such information, much of the public and political attention has been focused on the potential deadliness of the semiautomatic rifle, which law enforcement officials identified as a Smith & Wesson M&P15.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]] |url=http://www.latimes.com/nation/la-na-james-holmes-parents-20141219-story.html |title=James Holmes' parents plead for their son: 'He is not a monster' |first=Michael |last=Muskal |date=December 19, 2014 |accessdate=February 28, 2017 |quote=In May 2012, Holmes purchased a Glock 22, then bought the shotgun days later. After failing his oral exam, he bought a Smith & Wesson M&P15 semiautomatic rifle and a second Glock in July. He also purchased 3,000 rounds of ammunition for the pistols, 3,000 rounds for the M&P15, and 350 shells for the shotgun over the Internet, police have said. Holmes is accused of buying a ticket to the midnight showing of the Batman movie “The Dark Knight Rises,” then leaving and returning to the theater, dressed in tactical gear. He opened fire with a 12-gauge shotgun, a semiautomatic rifle with a drum magazine of ammunition and a Glock handgun.}}</ref> the [[2013 Los Angeles International Airport shooting]],<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nytimes.com/2013/12/18/us/suspect-in-tsa-agents-killing-is-indicted-on-11-charges.html |title=Suspect in T.S.A. Agent's Killing Is Indicted on 11 Charges |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |accessdate=February 28, 2017 |date=December 18, 2013 |first=Ian |last=Lovett |quote=The indictment alleges that Mr. Ciancia shot the three officers using a Smith & Wesson 5.56-millimeter M&P15 semiautomatic rifle.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-alleged-lax-shooter-indicted-20131217-story.html |title=Alleged LAX shooter indicted by federal grand jury |accessdate=February 28, 2017 |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]] |first=Kate |last=Mather |date=December 17, 2013 |quote=The final three counts are related to allegations that Ciancia used the Smith & Wesson M&P-15 to commit acts of violence at an international airport.}}</ref> and the [[2015 San Bernardino attack]].<ref>{{cite news |magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] |url=http://time.com/4136757/san-bernardino-shooting-gun-law-bullet-button/ |title=This Gun Law May Have Let the San Bernardino Attackers Shoot Faster |accessdate=February 28, 2017 |first=Victor |last=Luckerson |date=December 4, 2015 |quote=A carveout in a California gun law reportedly allowed for the legal purchase of two assault-style rifles that were used in the San Bernardino shooting Wednesday, which killed 14 people and injured 21 others, though the weapons were later altered illegally. Many guns in the style of the two AR-15 semiautomatic rifles, a . 223-caliber DPMS Model A15 and a Smith & Wesson M&P15, are banned under a 1989 California gun law targeting assault weapons. }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2015/12/04/us/weapons-in-san-bernardino-shootings-were-legally-obtained.html |title=Weapons in San Bernardino Shootings Were Legally Obtained |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |accessdate=February 28, 2017 |first=Mike |last=McIntire |date=December 3, 2015 |quote=The police in San Bernardino said Thursday that the husband-and-wife suspects, Syed Rizwan Farook and Tashfeen Malik, had at least four high-capacity magazines and more than a thousand rounds of ammunition. Law enforcement specialists who briefed congressional officials on Thursday said that Mr. Farook bought two pistols legally and that another person bought the two .223-caliber rifles — a DPMS A-15 and Smith & Wesson M&P15 — legally.}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.latimes.com/local/lanow/la-me-ln-san-bernardino-suspects-sprayed-the-room-with-bullets-20151203-story.html |title=San Bernardino suspects 'sprayed the room with bullets,' police chief says |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]] |date=December 3, 2015 |accessdate=February 28, 2017 |first1=Rong-Gong |last1=Lin II |first2=Richard |last2=Winton |quote=The rifles were a .223-caliber DPMS Model A15 and a Smith & Wesson M&P15.}}</ref></blockquote>
{{Reflist-talk}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_5482E3B|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2017-03-20 02:01 ===
* Id: 5482E3B
* User: BrownHairedGirl
* Date: 2017-03-01 05:48:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|768006290|POLICY 768006290}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|771187179|POLICY 771187179}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The recent RFC on notability of secondary schools[https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?oldid=767614516#RfC_on_secondary_school_notability] was closed with a finding of 4 keys points, the second of which was that {{tq|WP:SCHOOLOUTCOMES should be added to the Arguments to avoid in deletion discussions, as it is an accurate statement of the results but promotes circular reasoning}}.

Since this principle has been accepted, then why should it be applied only to schools?  Exactly the same problem of circular reasoning applies to use of [[WP:OUTCOMES]] in every other deletion discussion, from astronauts to zoology. The principle is already set out at [[WP:OUTCOMES#Citing_this_page_in_AfD]], but has not been carried through to [[WP:ATA]].

'''[[WP:OUTCOMES]] as a whole should be added to the [[Wikipedia:Arguments to avoid in deletion discussions|Arguments to avoid in deletion discussions]]'''. --[[User:BrownHairedGirl|<span style="color:#663200;">Brown</span>HairedGirl]] <small>[[User talk:BrownHairedGirl|(talk)]] • ([[Special:Contributions/BrownHairedGirl|contribs]])</small> 05:48, 1 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Articles for deletion#rfc_94E8AE8|Wikipedia talk:Articles for deletion]] expired 2017-03-20 20:02 ===
* Id: 94E8AE8
* User: J947
* Date: 2017-03-19 18:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|771131984|PROP 771131984}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|771306126|PROP 771306126}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Here is an RfC on the creation of a new user right that along with administrators can close and relist XfD (AfD, CfD, MfD, RfD, and TfD) discussions exclusively. This will eliminate most malformed closures, relists without the discussions not being transferred into the appropriate log, and so on and so forth.

Therefore I am proposing for a creation of a new user right known as 'XfD closer', and have that right automatically granted to users with at least '''at least 50 uncontested closes of XfDs in the past six months, with less then 5% of all closes in the same period being contested''' to this policy being enacted. These users will be allowed to close and relist discussions, but not as 'delete' or 'speedy delete'. Admins will continue to close discussions as normal.

There will be a page for requesting rights at [[WP:RFR|PERM]], and users there will be expected to have at least 1,500 edits—including 50 wikipedia-space edits—a tenure of at least 3 months, as well as demonstrated knowledge of policies and guidelines. XfDs for articles that have been deleted or obvious 'speedy keep's, can be closed by any editor. Feel free to place your opinion below, under the '[[!vote]]' section. '''<font color="#1009bf">[[User:J947|J]]</font><font color="#137412">[[User talk:J947|947]]</font>''' 18:42, 19 March 2017 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
The content currently says, in the [[Robert_Sungenis#Geocentrism|section on Geocentrism]]:

By 2006 he had become known as an advocate for this [[pseudoscience]].<ref name=TimesNews2006>{{cite news|last1=Sefton|first1=Drew|title=In this View, the Sun Revolves around the Earth|url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=_1kaAAAAIBAJ&sjid=XCYEAAAAIBAJ&dq=robert-sungenis&pg=6714,4991566|work=[[Religion News Service]] via The Times-News|date=March 30, 2006}}</ref><ref name=Gettys>{{cite web|last=Gettys|first=Travis|title=Why are geocentrists trying to undo centuries worth of accepted science? (Hint: The Jews)|url=http://www.rawstory.com/rs/2014/04/12/why-are-geocentrists-trying-to-undo-centuries-worth-of-accepted-science-hint-the-jews/|publisher=RawStory|accessdate=30 April 2014}}</ref><ref name=Loren>{{cite book|last1=Collins|first1=Loren|title=Bullspotting: Finding Facts in the Age of Misinformation|publisher=Prometheus Books|isbn=9781616146351|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=8gXvP3MCAqcC&pg=PT91|language=en}}</ref><ref name=Wiesner>{{cite journal|last1=Wiesner|first1=Matthew P.|title=Modern Geocentrism: A Case Study of Pseudoscience in Astronomy|journal=Skeptical Inquirer|date=January–February 2015|volume=39|issue=1}}</ref>

The underlined addition in the version below has been contested:

By 2006 he had become known as an advocate for this [[pseudoscience]]<u>, which has been described as being related to [[intelligent design]] and [[creationism]] in that it challenges scientific findings based on [[biblical literalism]] and on the misunderstanding that scientific knowledge undermines faith in God and the authority of religious institutions.</u><ref name=TimesNews2006/><ref name=Gettys/><ref name=Loren/><ref name=Wiesner/>

=== [[Talk:Reza Aslan#rfc_7B59159|Talk:Reza Aslan]] expired 2017-03-22 16:01 ===
* Id: 7B59159
* User: NPalgan2
* Date: 2017-03-10 22:42:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|769668770|BIO 769668770}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|771618732|BIO 771618732}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should [[Reza_Aslan#Believer_controversy]] include the following: The [[Hindu American Foundation]] has issued an official statement<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hafsite.org/statement-haf-executive-director-reza-aslan%E2%80%99s-%E2%80%9Cbeliever%E2%80%9D}}</ref> denying any "endorsement or approval" for the show, as claimed by Aslan in his Facebook Post and requesting him to "stop misrepresenting the extent of this one meeting"<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.hafsite.org/statement-haf-executive-director-reza-aslan%E2%80%99s-%E2%80%9Cbeliever%E2%80%9D}}</ref>. === [[Talk:Operation Storm#rfc_147AF42|Talk:Operation Storm]] expired 2017-03-22 22:01 ===
* Id: 147AF42
* User: Bilseric
* Date: 2017-02-20 21:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|766564377|HIST 766564377}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|771675268|HIST 771675268}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the sentence:"The court ruled that a substantial part of the Serb population fled the RSK as a direct consequence of Operation Storm. The Croatian authorities were aware that the operation would lead to mass displacement and even predicated their military planning on such an exodus, which they considered not only probable, but desirable."  stay in the article? The problem is that this is a direct quote from a primary source and there's a reason why Wikipedia is using secondary sources. 

Furthermore, the sentence "In February 2015, at the conclusion of the Croatia–Serbia genocide case, the International Court of Justice (ICJ) dismissed a Serbian lawsuit which alleged that Operation Storm constituted genocide,[220] ruling that Croatia did not have the specific intent to exterminate the country's Serb minority, though it reaffirmed that serious crimes against Serb civilians had taken place.[220][221]" is in clash with the mentioned, following sentence. 

Also, "The court has ruled" is not supported by the referenced source. The court have made no such ruling, but it addressed a claim. Reading the source one can read a response to a claim :"'''At most''', the view might be taken that the Brioni Transcript shows that the leaders of
Croatia envisaged that the military offensive they were preparing would have the effect of causing
the flight of the great majority of the Serb population of the Krajina, that they were satisfied with
that consequence and that, in any case, they would do nothing to prevent it because, on the
contrary, they wished to encourage the departure of the Serb civilians"
"

For more info read the upper topic. [[User:Bilseric|Bilseric]] ([[User talk:Bilseric|talk]]) 21:40, 20 February 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Maksim Chmerkovskiy#rfc_5EE1A0E|Talk:Maksim Chmerkovskiy]] expired 2017-03-24 08:01 ===
* Id: 5EE1A0E
* User: Knope7
* Date: 2017-02-28 03:27:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|767826778|BIO 767826778}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|771920687|BIO 771920687}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I added the following into the article:

:{{quote|After his season 23 elimination, Chmerkovskiy publicly said that although he loved participated in the show, he had no interest in returning for season 24 when he would have a newborn son at home. [cited] Nevertheless, Chmerkovskiy and his fiance, Peta Murgatroyd, were the first two professional dancers announced for the season 24 cast with a joint appearance on ''Good Morning America'' and an ''[[Us Weekly]]'' cover story. [cited] }}

{{ping|Tenebrae}} objected to the tone and changed the content to the following: 

:{{quote|After his season 23 elimination, Chmerkovskiy said he did not plan to return for season 24. [cited]  Nevertheless, in February 2017, Chmerkovskiy and his fiancee Peta Murgatroyd announced they both would return. [cited]}}

As stated, Tenebrae has objected to the tone of my contribution and cited [[WP:TONE]]. I believe the tone of the content I added is appropriate, supported by the reliable sources cited, and the details are helpful distinguish the 24th season of the show (and somewhere around Chmerkovskiy's 16th season of the show) from any generic season. I also believe my contribution should have been kept under [[WP:Preserve]]. [[User:Knope7|Knope7]] ([[User talk:Knope7|talk]]) 03:27, 28 February 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Blue Army (Poland)#rfc_A7E36B5|Talk:Blue Army (Poland)]] expired 2017-03-24 18:01 ===
* Id: A7E36B5
* User: E-960
* Date: 2017-03-06 13:47:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|768911913|HIST 768911913}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|768911917|POL 768911917}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|771992844|HIST 771992844}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|771992846|POL 771992846}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''POV pushing, and Undue Weight.''' The first reference source cited in the article contains in its format the ENTIRE paragraph from Encyclopedia Judaica, instead of a simple citation of the source and a useful hyperlink (as is common in Wikipedia articles). 

Question: Should the reference source citation be re-edited to display standard reference information instead of excessively quoting all the text from a one sided source, potentially creating neutrality issues.

The reference source '''(Update: the link is currently dead and does not display any information)''' citation currently displays an excessive amount of text on the article page, which reads:

{{quote box
| border=2px
| align=center
| bgcolor =
| title=
| halign=left
| quote=
Encyclopedia Judaica. Retrieved 5 October 2015. Haller's army ("Blue Army"), force of Polish volunteers organized in France during the last year of World War I, responsible for the murder of Jews and anti-Jewish pogroms in Galicia and the Ukraine… Foreign officers and the ties with France kept Haller's forces independent of the official Polish command, a fact exploited by Haller's soldiers (called the "Hallerczycy") for undisciplined and unbridled excesses against Jewish communities in Galicia. Attacks on individual Jews on the streets and highways, murderous pogroms on Jewish settlements, and deliberate provocative acts became commonplace. While these may have been on the initiative of individual soldiers, they were known to their officers, if not openly supported by them. In 1920, during the Polish offensive toward Kiev resulting from the Pilsudski-Petlyura alliance, anti-Jewish pogroms occurred in the region.|}}
--[[User:E-960|E-960]] ([[User talk:E-960|talk]]) 13:47, 6 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Bot policy#rfc_72A4621|Wikipedia talk:Bot policy]] expired 2017-03-25 02:01 ===
* Id: 72A4621
* User: Headbomb
* Date: 2017-03-01 16:07:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|768072669|POLICY 768072669}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|768072671|TECH 768072671}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|772055172|POLICY 772055172}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_technical_issues_and_templates|prev|772055175|TECH 772055175}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This issue came up at the newly-filed [[Wikipedia:Bots/Requests for approval/TrustMeImAIRobot]], which would be a bot run by {{IP|89.28.5.39}}.

Current [[WP:BOTPOL|bot policy]] is that bot operators are "prominently identifiable" on the bot's user page. This is mostly to ensure that [[WP:BOTCOMM]] is followed, and to a lesser extent help the community deal with problematic issues from the bot operator should they arise (and I will note here I have no reason to suspect that IP 89.28.5.39 would be prone to such problematic issues). {{User|TrustMeImAIRobot}} currently identify its operator as {{IP|89.28.5.39}}, so in a strict reading of the policy, one might argue the policy's requirements are met. I'm not sure however, this is is what the community intended to require.

So, regardless of they are currently allowed by current policy, should IPs be allowed to operate bots? <span style="font-variant:small-caps; whitespace:nowrap;">[[User:Headbomb|Headbomb]] {[[User talk:Headbomb|talk]] / [[Special:Contributions/Headbomb|contribs]] / [[WP:PHYS|physics]] / [[WP:WBOOKS|books]]}</span> 16:07, 1 March 2017 (UTC)}}

{{quote|Spicer's first official statement as press secretary was criticized for making what became called alternative facts regarding the inauguration's attendance numbers. In his statement, he also claimed that the inauguration was "the most watched ever", but subsequently stated that he was referring not only to live attendees at the ceremony or those watching on TV, but also viewers who watched the inauguration online. However, no conclusive figures are available for online viewers, and so such a claim cannot be substantiated.}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following text be included under the title "Fox News and Donald Trump controversy" (in "sub-section 2" font) under the sub-section "Sweden":

<blockquote>The issue of immigration and crime in Sweden received considerable attention in February 2017 after Fox News aired an interview with media personality [[Ami Horowitz]] and President Donald Trump implied, on the basis of the interview, that some horrible event related to immigration had occurred in Sweden a few days before. In that Fox News interview, Horowitz made numerous assertions about immigration and crime in Sweden, which have been deemed false or unsubstantiated by the Swedish authorities, criminologists and a wide range of news organizations and fact-checkers.<ref name=":02">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/19/world/europe/last-night-in-sweden-trumps-remark-baffles-a-nation.html|title=‘Last Night in Sweden’? Trump’s Remark Baffles a Nation|last=Chan|first=Sewell|date=2017-02-19|newspaper=The New York Times|access-date=2017-02-19|issn=0362-4331}}</ref><ref name=":110">{{Cite news|url=http://www.aftonbladet.se/nyheter/a/g26Lk|title=After Trump’s ‘Last night in Sweden’: Here are the errors in Fox News' report on Swedish immigration|newspaper=Aftonbladet|access-date=2017-02-20}}</ref><ref name=":210">{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/02/20/world/europe/trump-pursues-his-attack-on-sweden-with-scant-evidence.html|title=From an Anchor’s Lips to Trump’s Ears to Sweden’s Disbelief|last=Baker|first=Peter|date=2017-02-20|newspaper=The New York Times|access-date=2017-02-21|last2=Chan|first2=Sewell|issn=0362-4331}}</ref><ref name=":310">{{Cite news|url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2017-02-20/trumps-last-night-in-sweden-claim-prompts-questions-from-swedes/8284758|title=Trump says 'last night in Sweden' comment based on TV report|date=2017-02-20|newspaper=ABC News|access-date=2017-02-21|language=en-AU}}</ref><ref name=":42">{{Cite news|url=http://www.vox.com/world/2017/2/20/14669572/sweden-trump-immigrant-crime|title=What President Trump gets wrong about immigrants and crime in Sweden|last=Beauchamp|first=Zack|newspaper=Vox|access-date=2017-02-21}}</ref><ref name=":52">{{Cite web|url=http://www.thelocal.se/20170220/sweden-facts-a-closer-look-at-filmmaker-ami-horowitz-claims|title=sweden-facts-a-closer-look-at-filmmaker-ami-horowitz-claims|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref><ref name=":62">{{Cite web|url=http://www.factcheck.org/2017/02/trump-exaggerates-swedish-crime/|title=Trump Exaggerates Swedish Crime|website=www.factcheck.org|language=en-US|access-date=2017-02-21}}</ref><ref name=":72">{{Cite news|url=http://www.politifact.com/truth-o-meter/article/2017/feb/20/what-statistics-say-about-immigration-and-sweden/|title=Facts on Sweden, immigration and crime|newspaper=PolitiFact|access-date=2017-02-21|language=en}}</ref> Furthermore, two policemen who featured in a Horowitz documentary about Sweden said that Horowitz edited answers and questions to misrepresent the policemen.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/nyheter/swedish-police-featured-in-fox-news-segment-filmmaker-is-a-madman/|title=Swedish police featured in Fox News segment: Filmmaker is a madman - DN.SE|date=2017-02-20|newspaper=DN.SE|access-date=2017-02-21|language=sv-se}}</ref> Two camermen involved in the project later substantiated that the policemen were correct and that the footage had been unethically edited to misrepresent the subjects.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://sverigesradio.se/sida/artikel.aspx?programid=2054&artikel=6637732|title=US film on Swedish crime unethically edited, say cameramen - Radio Sweden|last=Radio|first=Sveriges|access-date=2017-02-23}}</ref> The cameramen also reviewed the raw films to confirm it.<ref>"[http://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/he-filmed-the-police-interview-that-trump-saw-the-material-was-not-edited-ethically/ He filmed the police interview that Trump saw: The material was not edited ethically]". ''Dagens Nyheter''.</ref> Horowitz denies it, but refused to show the raw material.<ref>"[http://www.dn.se/kultur-noje/ami-horowitz-about-the-criticism-everyone-involved-is-in-the-middle-of-a-shit-storm/ Ami Horowitz about the criticism: Everyone involved is in the middle of a shit storm]". ''Dagens Nyheter''.</ref> </blockquote>

<blockquote>Later in February 2017, Fox News interviewed a Nils Bildt, who was described as a ”Swedish defense and national security advisor”, about the alleged problems of immigrant criminality in Swedish cities.<ref name=":41">{{Cite news|url=http://www.dn.se/nyheter/varlden/fake-sweden-expert-on-fox-news-has-criminal-convictions-in-us-no-connection-to-swedish-security/|title=Fake Sweden expert on Fox News – has criminal convictions in US, no connection to Swedish security - DN.SE|date=2017-02-24|newspaper=DN.SE|access-date=2017-02-25|language=sv-se}}</ref> It was later revealed that Bildt had no known connection to Swedish security, had not lived in Sweden since 1994, and had himself a violent criminal past.<ref name=":41" /> </blockquote>
{{reflist-talk}}
[[User:Snooganssnoogans|Snooganssnoogans]] ([[User talk:Snooganssnoogans|talk]]) 22:10, 27 February 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Czech Republic#rfc_3FE6D26|Talk:Czech Republic]] expired 2017-03-26 15:01 ===
* Id: 3FE6D26
* User: DMacks
* Date: 2017-03-13 18:06:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|770152782|POL 770152782}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|772309877|POL 772309877}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For months, this talkpage has been dominated by editors thinking we should rename the article to "Czechia" and/or that we should use that as the main identity for this article's topic in the prose. Every time, lots of heat, but no new ideas brought to bear, and consensus every time is that there is no policy- or guideline-based reason to change at this time. Instead, the consensus is that ''at some point in the future'' it ''may'' be appropriate to change it, based on what situations may or may not change over time external to Wikipedia, and that there is no deadline to do such change let alone do it "too soon". In the interest of saving everyone time and not drowning out other article-content discussions, I am here proposing a moratorium on any such discussions for six months, during which time any such discussions would be promptly closed with a pointer to this RFC. [[User:DMacks|DMacks]] ([[User talk:DMacks|talk]]) 18:06, 13 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Bot policy#rfc_41A6739|Wikipedia talk:Bot policy]] expired 2017-03-26 17:01 ===
* Id: 41A6739
* User: Anomie/Sandbox2
* Date: 2017-03-26 11:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|772296049|UNSORTED 772296049}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|772325545|UNSORTED 772325545}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
== [[WP:COSMETICBOT]] update '''

The current policy of [[WP:COSMETICBOT]], while relatively clear in its intent, is currently fairly vague in practice, and short on examples. Several of us (both BAG and non-BAG members) have drafted [[User:Anomie/Sandbox2]] ([[User talk:Anomie/Sandbox2|talk]], see also a [[Wikipedia_talk:Bot_policy/Archive_26#Defining_cosmetic_changes|prior discussion]]) to 1) the motivation for this policy 2) clarify what the terms ''cosmetic'', ''substantial/non-cosmetic'', and ''minor'' edit typically refer to, 3) to clarify under what conditions bots may or may not make such changes 4) how to deal with undesired cosmetic edits.

This RFC is to see if the proposed update/wording has consensus. Refinements can be made during the RFC if issues are found with it. <span style="font-variant:small-caps; whitespace:nowrap;">[[User:Headbomb|Headbomb]] {[[User talk:Headbomb|talk]] / [[Special:Contributions/Headbomb|contribs]] / [[WP:PHYS|physics]] / [[WP:WBOOKS|books]]}</span> 11:46, 26 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Donald Trump#rfc_A0F92C0|Talk:Donald Trump]] expired 2017-03-27 01:01 ===
* Id: A0F92C0
* User: MelanieN
* Date: 2017-02-26 15:00:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|767570972|BIO 767570972}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|767570981|POL 767570981}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|772394729|BIO 772394729}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|772394732|POL 772394732}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
This is about the final phrase of a sentence in the lede - 
:::'''Current Version''': He became [[List of Presidents of the United States by age|the oldest]] and [[List of Presidents of the United States by net worth|wealthiest]] person to assume the presidency, the first without [[List of Presidents of the United States by previous experience|prior military or government service]], and [[United States presidential elections in which the winner lost the popular vote|the fifth elected with less]] than a [[plurality (voting)|plurality]] of the [[Popular vote (representative democracy)|national popular vote]]. 

The question is whether to replace the current wording of the final phrase. The earlier part of the sentence is a consensus version and is not under discussion here, only the final phrase. This has been ''extensively'' discussed [[Talk:Donald Trump#Changes without consensus; time to move on?|above]], and after much discussion and compromise we have come up with the following choices, which should be the basis of this RfC. 
**Option 1: The wording currently in the article: ''...and [[United States presidential elections in which the winner lost the popular vote|the fifth elected with less]] than a [[plurality (voting)|plurality]] of the [[Popular vote (representative democracy)|national popular vote]].''
**Option 2: ''...and [[United States presidential elections in which the winner lost the popular vote|the fifth to have lost]]  the [[Popular vote (representative democracy)|national popular vote]].'' --[[User:MelanieN|MelanieN]] ([[User talk:MelanieN|talk]]) 15:00, 26 February 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:1873 in Germany#rfc_2F58941|Talk:1873 in Germany]] expired 2017-03-27 08:01 ===
* Id: 2F58941
* User: Vami_IV
* Date: 2017-03-27 00:44:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|772394737|UNSORTED 772394737}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Unsorted|prev|772435503|UNSORTED 772435503}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the process of formatting "[YEAR] in Germany" pages, I have encountered a conundrum: The earlier the year, the more likely you are to run into persons who were born in parts of Germany that are no longer part of Germany, primarily Prussians. I haven't been able to decide by myself whether or not to write "born in Poland" for the link to the year they were born/died in or "born in Germany", so I decided to find out what the opinion of the Encyclopedia is.

&ndash;[[User:Vami_IV|<span style="background:crimson; color:white; padding:2px;">Vami</span>]][[User talk:Vami_IV|<span style="background:#e2e2e2; color:crimson; padding:2px;">_IV✠</span>]] 00:44, 27 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)#rfc_803B4DA|Wikipedia:Village pump (policy)]] expired 2017-03-27 13:01 ===
* Id: 803B4DA
* User: &#42;Kat*
* Date: 2017-02-26 13:14:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|767588869|POLICY 767588869}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|772465346|POLICY 772465346}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
For the past three years I have been using Private Internet Access VPN to make myself harder to track on the Internet.  I don't see myself stopping this practice anytime soon.  The only problem is that I can't edit wikipedia while logged into PIA. Most of the IP addresses are hard-blocked.  So, most of the time, I simply don't edit wikipedia at all.   I was hoping that this problem would resolve itself, but it has not.  So here I am, proposing a solution.

Although I understand the need to block anonymous edits and new-account edits on proxy-IPs, I do not understand why this block must be so comprehensive that it prohibits veteran wikipedians like myself from being able to edit while logged in. 

There is a technical solution already available to users in my position.  It is called the [[Wikipedia:IP block exemption]].  IP block exemptions are automatically granted to bots and admins.  Ordinary editors who are impacted through no fault of their own can also be granted IP Block Exemptions -- but only in extraordinary circumstances.  My proposal is that this policy be relaxed.  I also request that exemptions be granted to accounts that:

* have been around for five years and 
* have at least a thousand not-minor edits to their name.  
* Have not been blocked by an admin the last five years. 

Very, very few spammers and sock-puppeteers are willing to create an account, contribute over a thousand (non-minor) edits, and wait five years for IP Block Exemption status just so that they can abuse the exemption status.  But, if there are any, they will lose their exemption..  Keep in mind that this exemption would only apply to accounts that meet the above criteria.--[[User:&#42;Kat*|&#42;Kat*]] ([[User talk:&#42;Kat*|talk]]) 13:14, 26 February 2017 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the terminal information column be removed from all airline and destination tables at airport articles? '''-- [[User:Whats new?|Whats new?]]<sup>[[User talk:Whats new?|(talk)]]</sup>''' 02:54, 1 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Memphis Meats#rfc_E53CBC9|Talk:Memphis Meats]] expired 2017-03-28 03:01 ===
* Id: E53CBC9
* User: Jytdog
* Date: 2017-03-21 21:08:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|771501597|ECON 771501597}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|771501603|SCI 771501603}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Economy,_trade,_and_companies|prev|772576171|ECON 772576171}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|772576175|SCI 772576175}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
There are competing visions for this short article. The first paragraph is not contested: 

<blockquote>'''Memphis Meats''' is a [[food technology]] company headquartered in [[San Francisco]] aiming to "remake modern animal agriculture" by growing [[cultured meat]].<ref name="The Wall Street Journal">{{cite web|last1=Bunge|first1=Jacob|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/sizzling-steaks-may-soon-be-lab-grown-1454302862|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|accessdate=4 February 2016|title=Sizzling Steaks May Soon Be Lab-Grown}}</ref> The company was founded by three scientists: Uma Valeti ([[CEO]]), Nicholas Genovese ([[Chief Scientific Officer|CSO]]), and Will Clem.<ref name="Memphis Meats">{{cite web|url=http://www.memphismeats.com/the-team/|publisher=Memphis Meats|accessdate=4 February 2016|title=The Memphis Meats Team}}</ref> Valeti is a cardiologist and medical professor at the [[University of Minnesota]].<ref name="The Wall Street Journal" />

{{reflist-talk}}</blockquote>

;Version 1 of the 2nd paragraph

<blockquote>As of February 2016, it cost the company $18,000 to produce one pound of in-vitro beef, but the company expects to scale the process up and sell to consumers within five years.<ref name="Fox News" /><ref name="Fortune" /> It is also experimenting with stem cells from pigs and chickens.<ref name="Fox News">{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/leisure/2016/02/03/world-first-lab-grown-meatball-revealed/|publisher=Fox News|accessdate=4 February 2016|title='World's first' lab-grown meatball revealed}}</ref> Valeti claims that his product will be more sustainable than beef derived from butchering an animal, which requires 23-to-1 ratio of Calories used to Calories produced. Valeti claims that the company's process will reduce the ratio to 3-to-1. He also claims it will require 90% less water and land.<ref name=Fortune>{{cite web|url=http://fortune.com/2016/02/02/lab-grown-memphis-meats/|publisher=Fortune|accessdate=4 February 2016|title=You Could Be Eating Lab-Grown Meat in Just Five Years}}</ref> In February 2016, the company revealed a video showing the "world's first cultured meatball."<ref name="Fox News">{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/leisure/2016/02/03/world-first-lab-grown-meatball-revealed/|publisher=Fox News|accessdate=4 February 2016|title='World's first' lab-grown meatball revealed}}</ref><ref name=Fortune>{{cite web|url=http://fortune.com/2016/02/02/lab-grown-memphis-meats/|publisher=Fortune|accessdate=4 February 2016|title=You Could Be Eating Lab-Grown Meat in Just Five Years}}</ref><ref name="The Wall Street Journal">{{cite web|last1=Bunge|first1=Jacob|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/sizzling-steaks-may-soon-be-lab-grown-1454302862|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|accessdate=4 February 2016|title=Sizzling Steaks May Soon Be Lab-Grown}}</ref> In January 2016, the company released a video showcasing the world's first cultured meatball; in March 2017, they revealed chicken tenders and duck a l’orange, which the company deemed the world's first cultured poultry.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Bunge|first1=Jacob|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/startup-to-serve-up-chicken-strips-cultivated-from-cells-in-lab-1489570202|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|accessdate=17 March 2017|title=Startup Serves Up Chicken Produced From Cells in Lab}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Farber|first1=Madeline|url=http://fortune.com/2017/03/15/memphis-meats-lab-grown-chicken-peta/|publisher=Fortune|accessdate=17 March 2017|title=A San Francisco Startup Is Serving Chicken That Was Made in a Lab}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Kooser|first1=Amanda|url=https://www.cnet.com/au/news/chicken-duck-meat-memphis-meats-lab-clean/|publisher=CNET|accessdate=17 March 2017|title=This lab-grown chicken and duck meat looks surprisingly delicious}}</ref>

{{reflist}}</blockquote>

;Version 2 of the 2nd paragraph:

<blockquote>The company plans to produce various meat products using [[biotechnology]] to induce [[stem cells]] to differentiate into [[muscle tissue]] and to manufacture the meat  products <u>in [[bioreactors]]</u><s>using [[industrial fermentation]]</s>.<ref name="The Wall Street Journal">{{cite web|last1=Bunge|first1=Jacob|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/sizzling-steaks-may-soon-be-lab-grown-1454302862|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|accessdate=4 February 2016|title=Sizzling Steaks May Soon Be Lab-Grown}}</ref>  As of February 2016, it cost the company $18,000 to produce one pound of in-vitro beef, but the company expected to scale the process up and sell to consumers within five years.<ref name="The Wall Street Journal"/> As of March 2017, the company had demonstrated prototype meatball, chicken, and duck products.<ref name="The Wall Street Journal"/><ref>{{cite web|last1=Bunge|first1=Jacob|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/startup-to-serve-up-chicken-strips-cultivated-from-cells-in-lab-1489570202|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|accessdate=17 March 2017|title=Startup Serves Up Chicken Produced From Cells in Lab}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Kooser|first1=Amanda|url=https://www.cnet.com/au/news/chicken-duck-meat-memphis-meats-lab-clean/|publisher=CNET|accessdate=17 March 2017|title=This lab-grown chicken and duck meat looks surprisingly delicious}}</ref>

{{reflist-talk}}</blockquote>

;Version 3 (note, this was added after 3 !votes had been cast; all three !voters notified of change)
<blockquote>In February 2016, the company released a video showing what it called "the world's first cultured meatball."<ref name="Fox News">{{cite web|url=http://www.foxnews.com/leisure/2016/02/03/world-first-lab-grown-meatball-revealed/|publisher=Fox News|accessdate=4 February 2016|title='World's first' lab-grown meatball revealed}}</ref><ref name="Fortune">{{cite web|last1=Addady|first1=Michal|url=http://fortune.com/2016/02/02/lab-grown-memphis-meats/|publisher=Fortune|accessdate=4 February 2016|title=You Could Be Eating Lab-Grown Meat in Just Five Years}}</ref><ref name="WSJ Meatball">{{cite web|last1=Bunge|first1=Jacob|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/sizzling-steaks-may-soon-be-lab-grown-1454302862|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|accessdate=4 February 2016|title=Sizzling Steaks May Soon Be Lab-Grown}}</ref> The company claimed it cost $18,000 to produce one pound of cultured beef, but it expected to scale the process up and sell to consumers within five years.<ref name="WSJ Meatball"/> The company praised the taste of the product as well as the sustainability benefits.<ref name=Fortune>{{cite web|url=http://fortune.com/2016/02/02/lab-grown-memphis-meats/|publisher=Fortune|accessdate=4 February 2016|title=You Could Be Eating Lab-Grown Meat in Just Five Years}}</ref> In March 2017, it release a similar video showing chicken tenders and duck a l’orange, which the company deemed the world's first cultured poultry.<ref name="WSJ Poultry">{{cite web|last1=Bunge|first1=Jacob|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/startup-to-serve-up-chicken-strips-cultivated-from-cells-in-lab-1489570202|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|accessdate=17 March 2017|title=Startup Serves Up Chicken Produced From Cells in Lab}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Farber|first1=Madeline|url=http://fortune.com/2017/03/15/memphis-meats-lab-grown-chicken-peta/|publisher=Fortune|accessdate=17 March 2017|title=A San Francisco Startup Is Serving Chicken That Was Made in a Lab}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Kooser|first1=Amanda|url=https://www.cnet.com/au/news/chicken-duck-meat-memphis-meats-lab-clean/|publisher=CNET|accessdate=17 March 2017|title=This lab-grown chicken and duck meat looks surprisingly delicious}}</ref> The company said a pound of cultured chicken cost $9,000 and reiterated the expected commercial release of 2021.<ref name="WSJ Poultry" />

{{reflist-talk}}</blockquote>

;Version 4 of the 2nd paragraph:

<blockquote><s>The company plans to produce various meat products using [[biotechnology]] to induce [[stem cells]] to differentiate into [[muscle tissue]] and to manufacture the meat  products in [[bioreactors]].<ref name="The Wall Street Journal">{{cite web|last1=Bunge|first1=Jacob|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/sizzling-steaks-may-soon-be-lab-grown-1454302862|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|accessdate=4 February 2016|title=Sizzling Steaks May Soon Be Lab-Grown}}</ref> Memphis Meats has published videos of what it deemed "meatless" meatballs, chicken tenders and duck a l'orange.<ref>{{cite magazine |last=Gelman |first=Susan |date=February 29, 2016 |title=Meat Without Misery |url=https://commonreader.wustl.edu/memphis-meats/ |magazine=The Common Reader |location=Online |access-date=March 22, 2017 }}</ref><ref name="WSJ Poultry">{{cite web|last1=Bunge|first1=Jacob|url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/startup-to-serve-up-chicken-strips-cultivated-from-cells-in-lab-1489570202|publisher=The Wall Street Journal|accessdate=17 March 2017|title=Startup Serves Up Chicken Produced From Cells in Lab}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Farber|first1=Madeline|url=http://fortune.com/2017/03/15/memphis-meats-lab-grown-chicken-peta/|publisher=Fortune|accessdate=17 March 2017|title=A San Francisco Startup Is Serving Chicken That Was Made in a Lab}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|last1=Kooser|first1=Amanda|url=https://www.cnet.com/au/news/chicken-duck-meat-memphis-meats-lab-clean/|publisher=CNET|accessdate=17 March 2017|title=This lab-grown chicken and duck meat looks surprisingly delicious}}</ref> At the time of their production, the company said the production cost of its in-vitro beef was $18,000 per pound, while its cultured chicken and duck products cost $9,000 per pound.<ref name="WSJ Poultry"/><ref name="Fox News">{{cite Years}}</s></ref>

Please indicate which version you understand best complies with WP policies and guidelines.  [[User:Jytdog|Jytdog]] ([[User talk:Jytdog|talk]]) 21:08, 21 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Notability (people)#rfc_966D848|Wikipedia talk:Notability (people)]] expired 2017-03-28 14:01 ===
* Id: 966D848
* User: Ad Orientem
* Date: 2017-03-09 15:23:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|769444286|BIO 769444286}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|769444289|HIST 769444289}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|769444296|POLICY 769444296}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|772641611|BIO 772641611}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|772641614|HIST 772641614}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|772641620|POLICY 772641620}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
'''Background''' Based on the outcome and commentary in these two AfD discussions ([https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion/Leslie_Lynch_King,_Sr. ] and [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:Articles_for_deletion/Leslie_Lynch_King_Sr. ]) there appears to be a rough consensus that WP:1E does not apply to at least the fathers of US Presidents. As I am reading things this exemption still requires in depth coverage from multiple reliable sources, but effectively sets aside the 1E exception to GNG/ANYBIO for parents (or at least fathers) of US Presidents even if their relationship to their son is their only claim to notability. For clarification I have always accepted that some parents of presidents or other leaders would be notable either for something independent of their child's place in history or because they are part of some sort of hereditary system of government, dynastic rule etc.

'''Question''' How far does this exemption extend?  Does it apply to both parents? Does it apply only to US presidents or does it extend to the parents of other heads of state/government, again assuming there is RS coverage of the subject? The potential extent of this exception to 1E is considerable, and at least one editor in the most recent AfD responded to this question by asserting it should only apply to the parents of US Presidents. I think this is a subject where some clarification is needed in order to head off other potential debates at AfD or elsewhere. -[[User:Ad Orientem|Ad Orientem]] ([[User talk:Ad Orientem|talk]]) 15:23, 9 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:List of violent incidents in the Israeli–Palestinian conflict, January–June 2016#rfc_4D33A8A|Talk:List of violent incidents in the Israeli–Palestinian conflict, January–June 2016]] expired 2017-03-28 14:01 ===
* Id: 4D33A8A
* User: Nishidani
* Date: 2017-03-04 16:39:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|768576784|HIST 768576784}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|772641614|HIST 772641614}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Several sources state that the sentence given by an Israeli court to Elor Azaria, 18 months for manslaughter after he shot a neutralized Palestinian assailant dead, was more lenient than the penalties given Palestinian children for throwing stones at traffic or soldiers. Is it fair to include the comparison, or should the text simply state the length of the sentence without reference to the comparison?[[User:Nishidani|Nishidani]] ([[User talk:Nishidani|talk]]) 16:39, 4 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Bikini Moon#rfc_F5F816C|Talk:Bikini Moon]] expired 2017-03-28 18:01 ===
* Id: F5F816C
* User: L3X1
* Date: 2017-03-22 21:31:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|771675265|BIO 771675265}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|771675271|MEDIA 771675271}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|771992842|BIO 771992842}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|772677946|MEDIA 772677946}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Currently the first sentence is this:
: ''Bikini Moon is an upcoming 2017 film by Academy-award nominee Milcho Manchevski.''
I don't think ''Academy-award nominee'' is necessary. First off, its ''only'' a nominee-ship. There are other things to tout for Milcho than a failed Academy chance. Second, its from 1994. Isn't there something more relevant that Milcho is known for? I think the first sentence should be
:''Bikini Moon is an upcoming 2017 film directed by [[Milcho Manchevski]].'' 
As this is clear and to the point, without trying to impute some goodness upon the film by virtue of the director being a 1994 Academy Award nominee. I think of it as reverse Poisoning-the-well, attempting to influence how a reader will perceive something, and that is not neutrality, not balanced editing. 
Lastly I appeal to what other things are. Consider [[Star Wars: The Force Awakens|The Force Awakens]] or [[The Bridge on the River Kwai]]. They do not say "created by Award winning director…" even though [[David Lean]] won '''2 Awards''' for best director. If other films don't start off praising the director in the very first sentence, why should Biki  Moon? [[User:L3X1|L3X1]] [[User talk:L3X1|<small>(distant write)</small>]] 21:31, 22 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Protection policy#rfc_D8F58D4|Wikipedia talk:Protection policy]] expired 2017-03-29 05:01 ===
* Id: D8F58D4
* User: FriyMan
* Date: 2017-03-28 09:01:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|772615873|PROP 772615873}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_proposals|prev|772759540|PROP 772759540}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The "Protector" permission would give a user permissions to semi-protect, pending changes protect and extended confirmed protect pages indefinitely or temporarily. The users given this permission will help admins, patrolling [[WP:RPP]]. To become a  "Protector", you will have to have a perfect understanding of the protection policy and have shown it through successfully requesting the protection of approximately 10 pages. To help admins, all of the actions (protect, unprotect) will be logged in something like Special:Protector log. I am happy to listen to constructive feedback, given by you. [[User:FriyMan|<font color="#000000">'''Friy'''</font><font color="#FFA500">'''Man'''</font>]] [[User talk:FriyMan|<sup>talk</sup>]] 09:01, 28 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Layout#rfc_C47C578|Wikipedia talk:Manual of Style/Layout]] expired 2017-03-29 18:01 ===
* Id: C47C578
* User: Herostratus
* Date: 2017-02-27 17:40:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|767741122|STYLE 767741122}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|772845262|STYLE 772845262}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
In the section "Standard appendices and footers", in the subsection "'See also' section" ([[MOS:SEEALSO]] or [[WP:ALSO]]), the fourth paragraph has
:''{{xt|As a general rule, the "See also" section should '''not''' repeat links that appear in the article's body or its navigation boxes.}}''
This proposal is to remove the reference to article body (and FWIW also the bolding), leaving only the proscription regarding navigation boxes, thus:
:''{{xt|As a general rule, the "See also" section should not repeat links that appear in the article's  navigation boxes.}}''
{{clear}} [[User:Herostratus|Herostratus]] ([[User talk:Herostratus|talk]]) 17:40, 27 February 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Malcolm Wanklyn#rfc_759C24E|Talk:Malcolm Wanklyn]] expired 2017-03-30 11:01 ===
* Id: 759C24E
* User: Olonia
* Date: 2017-03-24 07:16:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|771920690|HIST 771920690}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|772953540|HIST 772953540}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I and another user have been discussing back and forth about some events involving submarine HMS Upholder in WWII. External opinions on the matter would be sorely needed.--[[User:Olonia|Olonia]] ([[User talk:Olonia|talk]]) 07:16, 24 March 2017 (UTC)}}
I wish to ask Wiki editors whether or not events leading up to 1948 should be mentioned in the section entitled, "Prior to 1948"? That, is there a consensus to add the following paragraph:
:{{bq|Considering the history of violence between Jews and Arabs in [[Palestine (region)|Palestine]] prior to 1948, Britain decided in 1936 to divide Palestine between the Jews and Arabs. "The commission, under [[William Peel, 1st Earl Peel|Lord Peel]], was appointed on 7 August 1936 to investigate the cause for the outbreak of the Arab rebellion and the way the Articles of the Mandate were being implemented. Between November 1936 and January 1937 the commission studied the situation in the country, and in June 1937 published its recommendation to abolish the Mandate and to divide the country between Arabs and Jews." [Source: ''The Survey of Palestine under the British Mandate: 1920 - 1948'', published by the British Mandate government printing office in Jerusalem in 1946, p. 166] The UN adopted the same position in 1947, with, however, the Arabs rejecting the 1947 proposed UN Partition Plan.[Source...] War soon broke-out, with Egypt sending troops into the country to help secure the country for an Arab state, without any recognition of Israeli sovereignty. At the conclusion of armed conflict, the interim borders were defined (delineated) by the outcome of war, with the Jordanian army taking-up positions within the territories seen by them as the future Arab state, although in scope considerably less than what was originally intended by Great Britain and the UN, since [[Ben-Gurion]] agreed that the paramilitary forces now made into the [[Israel Defense Forces|IDF]] be permitted to take-over the Negev, then occupied by Egyptian troops. In retrospect, lands taken by Jordan in 1948 were officially recognized as the "West Bank" of Jordan in the [[Armistice Agreements 1949|1949 Armistice agreement]], with lands conquered by Israel forming their ''de-facto'' territorial boundary. [Source: Zvi Dror, ''Har’el: Palmach brigade in Jerusalem'', Ha-kibbutz hameuchad Publishers: Benei Barak 2005, p. 273].}}
Perhaps even it may be seen as appropriate to bring down brief extracts from some of the more outstanding points in Arab-Jewish relations at that time, events that happened in Palestine before the general hostilities that broke-out in 1948. Are they important in this article? Should these incidents be addressed briefly, but '''without the use of harsh language''' that tend to denigrate one side or the other?Any advice?Any better suggestions?[[User:Davidbena|Davidbena]] ([[User talk:Davidbena|talk]]) 16:52, 15 March 2017 (UTC)}}

{{rfcquote|text=
* This article is about the phenomenon of Jews with antisemitic or antisemitic-like views, and not just about the phrase.

* The last deleted version was well sourced and the discussion of the living people was legitimate and widely discussed in mainstream media. So this is [[Wikipedia:Crying "BLP!"]]

Please read the discussion above at length.

=== [[Talk:Opioid use disorder#rfc_93CBF09|Talk:Opioid use disorder]] expired 2017-03-30 15:01 ===
* Id: 93CBF09
* User: Doc James
* Date: 2017-03-28 06:45:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|772597562|SCI 772597562}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Maths,_science,_and_technology|prev|772980655|SCI 772980655}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
How should we define OUD in the first sentence of the article. The ref from the CDC says:

"[https://www.cdc.gov/drugoverdose/opioids/ A problematic pattern of opioid use that causes clinically significant impairment or distress.]"
[[User:Doc James|<span style="color:#0000f1">'''Doc James'''</span>]] ([[User talk:Doc James|talk]] · [[Special:Contributions/Doc James|contribs]] · [[Special:EmailUser/Doc James|email]]) 06:45, 28 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sebastian Gorka#rfc_F6367BE|Talk:Sebastian Gorka]] expired 2017-03-30 19:01 ===
* Id: F6367BE
* Date: 2017-02-28 18:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|767922499|BIO 767922499}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|767922507|POL 767922507}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|767964257|HIST 767964257}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Biographies|prev|773013285|BIO 773013285}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/History_and_geography|prev|773013288|HIST 773013288}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|773013294|POL 773013294}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the article cover the story by ''The Forward'' regarding Gorka and antisemitism?

* ''The Forward'' published [http://forward.com/news/national/364094/four-things-you-need-to-know-about-trumps-deputy-assistant-and-his-ties-to/ a story] accusing Gorka of being antisemitic.
* This story was cited by others, including ''[http://www.haaretz.com/us-news/1.773663 Haaretz]'', ''[http://foreignpolicy.com/2017/02/24/trump-aide-reportedly-tied-to-far-right-hungarian-group/ Foreign Policy]'', and ''[http://nymag.com/daily/intelligencer/2017/02/sebastian-gorka-has-links-to-anti-semitic-groups.html New York Magazine]''.
* The story by ''The Forward'' in particular has been questioned by other sources, including ''[https://pjmedia.com/blog/in-hungary-sebastian-gorka-fought-and-tried-to-undermine-the-anti-semitism-of-the-far-right/ PJ Media]'', ''[http://www.washingtonexaminer.com/the-bizarre-campaign-against-trump-aide-seb-gorka/article/2615854 The Washington Examiner]'', and ''[https://www.forbes.com/sites/richardminiter/2017/02/28/journalists-beware-your-jihad-on-sebastian-gorka-is-only-hurting-you/#58dfc9093241 Forbes]''.  

[[User:Timothyjosephwood|<span style="color:#a56d3f;font-family:Impact;">Timothy</span><span style="color:#6f3800;font-family:Impact;">Joseph</span><span style="color:#422501;font-family:Impact;">Wood</span>]] 18:57, 28 February 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Sebastian Gorka#rfc_88BB478|Talk:Sebastian Gorka]] expired 2017-03-30 19:01 ===
* Id: 88BB478
* User: Snooganssnoogans
* Date: 2017-03-09 21:51:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|769493867|POL 769493867}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|774500729|POL 774500729}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following text be included in the article?:

<blockquote> In February 2017, the Forward reported that while Gorka was active in Hungarian politics, he had "close ties then to Hungarian far-right circles". The Forward also reported that he "has in the past chosen to work with openly racist and anti-Semitic groups and public figures." The Forward found that "Gorka’s involvement with the far right includes co-founding a political party with former prominent members of Jobbik, a political party with a well-known history of anti-Semitism; repeatedly publishing articles in a newspaper known for its anti-Semitic and racist content; and attending events with some of Hungary’s most notorious extreme-right figures." Anti-Defamation League CEO Jonathan Greenblatt issued a statement calling on Gorka to "make it clear that he disavows the message and outlook of far-right parties such as Jobbik, which has a long history of stoking anti-Semitism in Hungary.”</blockquote>

The text is sourced to this article by ''the Forward''[http://forward.com/news/national/364085/sebastian-gorka-trump-aide-forged-key-ties-to-anti-semitic-groups-in-hunga/]. Pinging editors who commented on the previous malformed RfC: [[User:MjolnirPants]] [[User:Ltbuni]] [[User:Volunteer Marek]] [[User:Timothyjosephwood ]] [[User:Jason from nyc]] [[User:Neutrality]] [[User:DrFleischman]] [[User:Mikalra]] [[User:Cullen328]] [[User:Pincrete]] [[User:Winkelvi]] [[User:Snooganssnoogans|Snooganssnoogans]] ([[User talk:Snooganssnoogans|talk]]) 21:51, 9 March 2017 (UTC)}}

} }}"></span><span id="rfctag"></span>{{Mbox
|image=[[File:Dialog-information on.svg|40px]]
|type=notice
|text={{Userbox

| id            = [[File:Internet-group-chat.svg]]

}}'''An editor has [[Wikipedia:Requests for comment|requested comments]] from other editors for this discussion.''' {{#if:  | This page has been | Within 24 hours, this page will be}} added to the following list{{#if:|s|}}:
<!--
-->{{#if:|}}}}}<!--
-->{{#if:|}}}}}<!--
-->{{#if:|}}}}}<!--
-->{{#if:|}}}}}<!--
-->{{#if:|}}}}}<!--
-->{{#if:|}}}}}<!--

-->{{#if:|}}}}}<!--
-->{{#if:|}}}}}
When discussion has ended, remove this tag and it will be removed from the list. If this page is on additional lists, they will be noted below.
}}{{#ifeq:{{FULLPAGENAME}}|Template:Rfc||[[Category:Wikipedia requests for comment]]}}}}
[[Portal:Featured portals]] and related pages have just been boldly tagged as {{tl|historical}}, as there has been a lot of time without any activity in them. This was announced at [[Portal talk:Featured portals]], but being such a big step, it should be discussed at a more visible location, like here. First of all: which would be the best venue to discuss this and find out which is the consensus? A thread here, a RFC, some other location? 

Second: do everyone in here agree with this? Should we support the historical tag?

Third: if those pages become historical, should we remove them from the general [[Portal:Featured content]]? And what about the portals with featured stars? Do they get to keep them, or should a bot remove them? [[User:Cambalachero|Cambalachero]] ([[User talk:Cambalachero|talk]]) 18:48, 30 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Wikipedia talk:Administrators#rfc_2467D28|Wikipedia talk:Administrators]] expired 2017-03-30 22:01 ===
* Id: 2467D28
* User: Beeblebrox
* Date: 2017-03-12 21:32:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|770006425|POLICY 770006425}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_policies_and_guidelines|prev|773036833|POLICY 773036833}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
<div id="talk" class="plainlinks" style="border: 1px solid #CC9; margin: 1em 1em 1em 1em; text-align: left; padding:1em; clear: both; background-color: #F1F1DE">
It is proposed that the following text be added to the section on "Procedural removal for inactive administrators":

'''Notification will only be given the first time an administrator is near to being desysopped for inactivity. '''

The purpose of this minor change is to close a loophole that an extreme minority of administrators take advantage of, wherein they are informed of the imminent desysopping and make one or two minor or inconsequential edits in response, and then go inactive again. </div>

I would also very much appreciate it if we didn't get off track here, let's please just stick to discussing this one incremental change as opposed to a larger reform or redo of the entire policy. Thanks for your understanding. [[User:Beeblebrox|Beeblebrox]] ([[User talk:Beeblebrox|talk]]) 21:32, 12 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Fidesz#rfc_53F0323|Talk:Fidesz]] expired 2017-03-30 23:01 ===
* Id: 53F0323
* User: Snooganssnoogans
* Date: 2017-02-28 22:46:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|767957369|POL 767957369}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|773043742|POL 773043742}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the following content be included in this article:

<blockquote><p>Fidesz has adopted anti-immigration stances and rhetoric.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2015/10/12/447911182/a-race-to-the-far-right-in-hungarian-politics|title=A Race To The Far Right In Hungarian Politics|work=NPR.org|access-date=2017-02-28|language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/hungary-eu-referendum-refugee-quota-migrant-crisis-xenophobia-border-control-racism-a7341276.html|title=Hungary set to reject EU refugee quotas in referendum|date=2016-10-02|work=The Independent|access-date=2017-02-28|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref name=":0">{{Cite web|url=https://www.opendemocracy.net/can-europe-make-it/annabel-tremlett/hungary's-future-antiimmigration-antimulticulturalism-and-antiro|title=Hungary's future: anti-immigration, anti-multiculturalism and anti-Roma?|date=2015-08-03|website=openDemocracy|language=en|access-date=2017-02-28}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/jul/02/hungary-government-condemned-over-anti-immigration-drive|title=Hungary government condemned over anti-immigration drive|last=Nolan|first=Daniel|date=2015-07-02|work=The Guardian|access-date=2017-02-28|language=en-GB|issn=0261-3077}}</ref> Fidesz has been accused of xenophobia.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/us-hungary-orban-idUSKCN0SV1J020151106|title=Orban's ratings rise as Hungarian fence deters migrant 'invasion'|date=2016-11-06|work=Reuters|access-date=2017-02-28}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://america.aljazeera.com/articles/2015/9/1/hungarys-rightward-shift-fuels-stringent-refugee-policy.html|title=Hungary’s rightward shift fuels harsh refugee policy|access-date=2017-02-28}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.pri.org/stories/2015-05-31/hungary-lays-xenophobia-thick-national-questionnaire-about-immigration|title=Hungary lays the xenophobia on thick in national questionnaire about immigration|work=Public Radio International|access-date=2017-02-28|language=en-US}}</ref> In September 2016, Human Rights Watch said that the Fidesz government was engaging in a "xenophobic anti-Migrant campaign".<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.hrw.org/news/2016/09/13/hungarys-xenophobic-anti-migrant-campaign|title=Hungary’s Xenophobic Anti-Migrant Campaign|date=2016-09-13|work=Human Rights Watch|access-date=2017-02-28|language=en}}</ref></p></blockquote>

<blockquote><p>In April 2016, Israel's Ambassador to Hungary condemned the writings of Zsolt Bayer, co-founder of Fidesz, which he said "openly advocate anti-Semitic sentiments and incite against the Jewish People and the State of Israel."<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.timesofisrael.com/israels-envoy-to-hungary-blasts-mainstream-dailys-anti-semitic-columns/|title=Israel’s envoy to Hungary blasts mainstream daily’s ‘anti-Semitic’ columns|work=The Times of Israel|access-date=2017-02-28|language=en-US}}</ref> The Fidesz government gave Bayer a prestigious award in March 2016, which led the U.S. Holocaust Memorial Museum to condemn "the long-standing refusal of the leadership of Hungary’s ruling Fidesz Party to distance itself from Bayer, in spite of Bayer’s repeated pattern of racist, xenophobic, anti-Semitic, and anti-Roma incitement".<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.haaretz.com/world-news/europe/1.738395|title=U.S. Holocaust Museum Slams Hungary's Award to anti-Semitic Journalist|date=2017-08-24|work=Haaretz|access-date=2017-02-28|language=en}}</ref> The World Jewish Congress has said that Fidesz bear some responsibility for the rise of anti-Semitism in Hungary.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.reuters.com/article/us-hungary-antisemitism-idUSKBN0E10E420140521|title=Anti-Semitism taboo under threat in Hungary|date=2017-05-21|work=Reuters|access-date=2017-02-28}}</ref> The Fidesz government has downplayed the problem of rising antisemitism in the country, in addition to attributing it to the European Union.<ref name=":1">{{Cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/europe/prime-minister-viktor-orban-downplays-rising-anti-semitism-in-hungary-a-898319.html|title=Missing the Point: Hungarian Leader Whitewashes Anti-Semitism - SPIEGEL ONLINE - International|last=Germany|first=SPIEGEL ONLINE, Hamburg|website=SPIEGEL ONLINE|access-date=2017-02-28}}</ref></p></blockquote>

<blockquote><p>Fidesz has been accused of [[antiziganism]].<ref name=":2">{{Cite news|url=http://hungarytoday.hu/news/amnesty-international-slams-disappointing-hungary-worrysome-migration-refugee-policies-74205#|title=Amnesty International Slams "Most Disappointing" Hungary Over Its "Worrysome" Refugee Policies - Hungary Today|work=Hungary Today|access-date=2017-02-28|language=en-US}}</ref><ref name=":0" /><ref name=":1" /><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.thestar.com/news/world/2012/10/13/why_the_roma_are_fleeing_hungary_and_why_canada_is_shunning_them.html|title=Why the Roma are fleeing Hungary and why Canada is shunning them {{!}} Toronto Star|website=thestar.com|access-date=2017-02-28}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/europe/hungarian-journalist-says-roma-should-not-be-allowed-to-exist-a-876887.html|title=Hungary's Racism Problem: Orbán Friend Says Roma 'Shouldn't Be Allowed to Exist' - SPIEGEL ONLINE - International|last=Germany|first=SPIEGEL ONLINE, Hamburg|website=SPIEGEL ONLINE|access-date=2017-02-28}}</ref> Amnesty International has accused the Fidesz government of "discrimination against the Roma".<ref name=":2" />  Zsolt Bayer, co-founder of Fidesz, has written that "a significant part of the Roma are unfit for coexistence... They are not fit to live among people. These Roma are animals, and they behave like animals... These animals shouldn't be allowed to exist. In no way. That needs to be solved -- immediately and regardless of the method."<ref name=":3">{{Cite web|url=http://www.spiegel.de/international/europe/ruling-hungarian-fidesz-party-adopts-policies-of-far-right-jobbik-party-a-880590.html|title=Blurring Boundaries: Hungarian Leader Adopts Policies of Far-Right - SPIEGEL ONLINE - International|last=Germany|first=SPIEGEL ONLINE, Hamburg|website=SPIEGEL ONLINE|access-date=2017-02-28}}</ref> Nobody in the Fidesz party leadership condemned Bayer's writings, with some defending them.<ref name=":3" /> When 1,000 Neo-nazi demonstrators held a rally in the small village of Devecser (pop: ca 5,000) and threatening the Roma inhabitants of the town in an episode that received international attention, the Fidesz government did not issue a firm condemnation of the incident.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.bbc.com/news/world-europe-19439679|title=Hungary nationalists whip up anti-Roma feelings|last=Cain|first=Phil|date=2012-09-01|work=BBC News|access-date=2017-02-28|language=en-GB}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.economist.com/blogs/easternapproaches/2012/08/hungarian-anti-roma-marches|title=You are going to die here|date=2012-08-23|work=The Economist|access-date=2017-02-28|issn=0013-0613}}</ref></p></blockquote>
{{reflist-talk}}
[[User:Snooganssnoogans|Snooganssnoogans]] ([[User talk:Snooganssnoogans|talk]]) 22:46, 28 February 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:X-Men (film series)#rfc_27E06E1|Talk:X-Men (film series)]] expired 2017-03-31 00:01 ===
* Id: 27E06E1
* User: Brocicle
* Date: 2017-03-19 03:57:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|771038397|MEDIA 771038397}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|771038402|STYLE 771038402}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Media,_the_arts,_and_architecture|prev|773051368|MEDIA 773051368}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|773051375|STYLE 773051375}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
Should the title "X-Men (film series)" be changed to include confirmed tie in material specific to this X-Men universe? If supporting the move, please add the title you think it should be changed to. Some suggestions are:
* X-Men (cinematic franchise)
* X-Men (cinematic universe)
* X-Men (film franchise)
* X-Men (film universe)
* X-Men (Fox franchise)
* X-Men (20th Century Fox franchise)
* X-Men (franchise)
* X-Men (in live-action)
* X-Men (shared film continuity)
* X-Men (X-Universe)
* X-Men Universe
* X-Universe

[[User:Brocicle|Brocicle]] ([[User talk:Brocicle|talk]]) 03:57, 19 March 2017 (UTC)}}

=== [[Talk:Efforts to impeach Barack Obama#rfc_436012F|Talk:Efforts to impeach Barack Obama]] expired 2017-03-31 04:01 ===
* Id: 436012F
* Date: 2017-03-31 02:43:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Politics,_government,_and_law|prev|773071954|POL 773071954}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
I'm concerned WP:POV was breached by [[User:‎Xenophrenic]]. His edit https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Efforts_to_impeach_Barack_Obama&oldid=755890148 said "to properly convey speculative nature". [[WP:OR]] is not the job of Wikipedia. I could just as easily edit [[Efforts_to_impeach_George_W._Bush|George Bush's]] to properly convey the section "Invasion of Iraq" as "Bush's stupid misadventures" because speculation is needed there, am I right? Nudge nudge. Knowing what to expect, I will now go through the titles.

First, I would argue that repeating "Impeachment for" a dozen times is good for creating a mocking tone rather than simply covering the subject at hand.

{{Quote|text=Suggestions of impeachment}}

This title is rather trivial as the article is already named "efforts of impeachment". I replaced it with the category of the efforts like was done in [[Efforts_to_impeach_George_W._Bush|George Bush's]] Correct title:

Political views and actions

{{Quote|text=1.1 Impeachment for offering someone a job}}

This is proclaiming Wikipedia has backed the job as legitimate. Correct title:

Legitimacy of a hire 

{{Quote|text=1.2 Impeachment to prevent Obama from doing things}}

This is proclaiming Wikipedia has characterized Obama's actions as simply not being comatose. Correct title:

The President's agenda

{{Quote|text=1.3 No one talking about impeachment to prevent Immigration reform}}

This is proclaiming Wikipedia has backed Obama's Immigration as "reform", AKA the improvement or amendment of what is wrong, not the neutral "policy". Also, it misquoted the senator as saying that the fact that no one spoke yet was a reason to impeach. Correct title:

Immigration policy

{{Quote|text=1.4 Impeachment for "the most egregious cover-up in American history", Benghazi attack}}

This is proclaiming Wikipedia would put scarequotes on someone's claim (scarequotes are when there is no person being quoted). Further, the long title serves to mock the contents of the section. Finally, the topic was a response not an attack. Correct title:

Benghazi attack response 

{{Quote|text=1.5 Impeachment requested by a towhall meeting audience member}}

This is proclaiming Wikipedia believes the words of the audience member were in this case, incomprehensible. Lazy at best. Correct title:

Background check policy

{{Quote|text=1.6 Impeachment for being born outside the United States}}

This is proclaiming Wikipedia is fine with having the long title serve to mock the contents of the section. Correct title:

Birthplace 

{{Quote|text=1.7 Dreaming of impeaching Obama}}

I have to say here that before I noticed there was an article explaining why the congressman dreamed of impeaching Obama, there was a justification for it, being the IRS. [[User:‎Xenophrenic]] decided it was good enough for wikipedia to quote one of the most cherrypicking NYT articles I've ever seen lambasting a congressman for how he felt, but not why he felt it in the same interview. https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=Efforts_to_impeach_Barack_Obama&oldid=763740080

IRS policy

{{Quote|text=1.8 The impeachment hearing that wasn't}}

This is proclaiming Wikipedia believes the words of the congressman were in this case, incomprehensible. Lazy at best. Correct title:

The President's regard for the constitution 

{{Quote|text=1.9 Impeachment for allowing transgender students to use bathrooms}}

This is proclaiming Wikipedia has A: taken the position that Obama was personally responsible for this legislation and B: Characterized the legislation as impacting only trangender people C: Overly broadly stated it would prevent them from using all bathrooms. Correct title: 

Gender identity legislation passed during the Obama administration

Because of the total revert of my edit and incompetence of [[User:‎Xenophrenic]] I'm calling in the cavalry so this doesn't end up in an edit war.02:43, 31 March 2017 (UTC)}}


=== [[Talk:List of Mahinda College alumni#rfc_D1B4D09|Talk:List of Mahinda College alumni]] expired 2017-03-31 05:01 ===
* Id: D1B4D09
* User: Dan arndt
* Date: 2017-03-01 04:21:00
* Revisions affecting this RFC:
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|767999936|SOC 767999936}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|767999942|STYLE 767999942}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Society,_sports,_and_culture|prev|773083788|SOC 773083788}}
** {{Diff|Wikipedia:Requests_for_comment/Wikipedia_style_and_naming|prev|773083789|STYLE 773083789}}
* RFC Text:

{{rfcquote|text=
The list of alumni is currently proposed to be converted into a sortable table. An editor has disagreed with the conversion on the basis that converting it into a table may be more readable in complex situations, but for a secondary school alumni list with simple information it is totally unnecessary. Also stating that in their opinion the use of table restricts access to WP users who use laptops or desktop computers and that people who use mobile phones and other instruments will find it difficult to view due to technical restrictions in WP format. They have also argued that IP users will be discouraged to contribute after its conversion in to a table, as they are not familiar with using computer languages / wiki markup. The counter argument put forward by two other editors is that a table is more accessible means of understanding the information, which is why [[Wikipedia:Featured list criteria|Featured Lists]] are all tabulated/sortable tables not lists, particularly in this case as the list has over 80 entries. Despite the comments there isn't an accessibility issue when using a smart phone or tablet and in fact it is easier to view on these devices. In respect to IP editors there is more than adequate support available on WP for novice editors to assist them in editing pages such as this. 

These views are clearly expressed on the article's talkpage however an impasse has been reached where any changes to the article converting it to a sortable table are reverted by the opposing editor, without further justification. [[User:Dan arndt|Dan arndt]] ([[User talk:Dan arndt|talk]]) 04:21, 1 March 2017 (UTC)}}
